revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-18 01:36:29.000000000', 'message': 'Proxy floating IP calls to quantum

***** THIS PATCH IS NOT INTENDED FOR FOLSOM *****

Fixes bug 1023169. Also fixes bug 1031119.

In Folsom, floating IP support is moved to Quantum. By this commit floating IP
calls to nova are proxied to Quantum and nova command can be used to manage
floating IPs.

The network flags defined in nova.network.manager are moved to a separate file.
nova.network.manager is not loaded when quantum is enabled but some flags are
also used in nova.network.quantumv2.api. In OpenStack config mechanism we cannot
define a flag with a same name in multiple places even if one of them are imported,
so I created a new file for the network flags. (No new flags are introduced)

pip-requires is also updated and now requires python-quantumclient >=2.1 which
supports floating IP feature in Quantum.

Change-Id: I2c32948a8fe291601216dc62d546da64a8fb8428

Requires quantumclient >=2.1.

Change-Id: I62d79d60352f35ef81dc6bdf04770b5766f1a2bb
'}]
commit_message:
Proxy floating IP calls to quantum

***** THIS PATCH IS NOT INTENDED FOR FOLSOM *****

Fixes bug 1023169. Also fixes bug 1031119.

In Folsom, floating IP support is moved to Quantum. By this commit floating IP
calls to nova are proxied to Quantum and nova command can be used to manage
floating IPs.

The network flags defined in nova.network.manager are moved to a separate file.
nova.network.manager is not loaded when quantum is enabled but some flags are
also used in nova.network.quantumv2.api. In OpenStack config mechanism we cannot
define a flag with a same name in multiple places even if one of them are imported,
so I created a new file for the network flags. (No new flags are introduced)

pip-requires is also updated and now requires python-quantumclient >=2.1 which
supports floating IP feature in Quantum.

Change-Id: I2c32948a8fe291601216dc62d546da64a8fb8428

Requires quantumclient >=2.1.

Change-Id: I62d79d60352f35ef81dc6bdf04770b5766f1a2bb

commit_message:
Add nova_notifier notification driver for nova

This adds a new notification driver to be used by nova in order to intercept
instance deletion message before the instance is deleted. With this, we are
able to poll an instance about to be deleted before it disappers and
therefore not miss any meter.

This fixes bug #1005944

Change-Id: Ie039681e8e440cb9be2f30e3d72d9a2bc4ddf5ba
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Make DeregisterImage respect AWS EC2 specification

The return value of current deregister_image implementation is the AMI id.
Howerver, according to Amazon EC2 API documentation, the return value of
DeregisterImageResponse should be boolean.

See more detailed documentation in:
http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DeregisterImage.html

The example response:
<DeregisterImageResponse xmlns="http://ec2.amazonaws.com/doc/2012-08-15/">
  <requestId>59dbff89-35bd-4eac-99ed-be587EXAMPLE</requestId>
  <return>true</return>
</DeregisterImageResponse>

This patch changes the response and test case for deregister_image.

Fixes bug 1051752.

Change-Id: Ifd31b88ec4f575f50244079cdeed4c9ff57206f8

bug 1051822

When we associate a floating ip to a fixed port + IP, we test to make
sure that there is a router that router that connects the external
network to the internal network that the fixed port is on. It is a valid
configuration for this router to be owned by an admin tenant. Thus, we

'}]
commit_message:
use admin context when validating a floating-ip association

bug 1051822

When we associate a floating ip to a fixed port + IP, we test to make
sure that there is a router that router that connects the external
network to the internal network that the fixed port is on. It is a valid
configuration for this router to be owned by an admin tenant. Thus, we
need to search or these routers with an admin context.

Change-Id: I89e9e2ec198147110d102ac6497d4b8022407407

commit_message:
Fix volume deletion when device mapper is used

Call dmsetup remove if there is a /dev/mapper/nova--volumes-
element present.

Resolves bug 979020

Change-Id: Iddaaed411a77dda4bd32f9a97687ff17744119eb

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-17 21:32:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes error handling during schedule_run_instance

If there are not enough hosts available during a multi-instance launch,
every failing instance should be updated to error state, instead of
just the first instance. Currently only the first instance is set
to Error and the rest stay in building.

This patch makes a number of fixes to error handling during scheduling.

 * Moves instance faults into compute utils so they can be created
   from the scheduler.
 * Moves error handling into the driver so that each instance can be
   updated separately.
 * Sets an instance fault for failed scheduling
 * Sets task state back to none if there is a scheduling failure
 * Changes manager exception catch all to set all instances to error
   If there is an unexpected failure
 * Modifies tests to check for these states

In addition to the included tests, the code was manually verified on
a devstack install

Fixes bug 1051066

Change-Id: I49267ce4a21e2f7cc7a996fb2ed5d625f6794730

commit_message:
Fixes error handling during schedule_run_instance

If there are not enough hosts available during a multi-instance launch,
every failing instance should be updated to error state, instead of
just the first instance. Currently only the first instance is set
to Error and the rest stay in building.

This patch makes a number of fixes to error handling during scheduling.

 * Moves instance faults into compute utils so they can be created
   from the scheduler.
 * Moves error handling into the driver so that each instance can be
   updated separately.
 * Sets an instance fault for failed scheduling
 * Sets task state back to none if there is a scheduling failure
 * Modifies chance scheduler to stop returning a list of instances
   as it is not used.
 * Modifies tests to check for these states.

In addition to the included tests, the code was manually verified on
a devstack install

Fixes bug 1051066
Fixes bug 1019017

Change-Id: I49267ce4a21e2f7cc7a996fb2ed5d625f6794730

commit_message:
heat API : rename watch API

Rename heat-api-cloudwatch to heat-watch-api-cw
This aligns with the heat-api-cfn naming, and will
allow eventual openstack-specific heat-watch API to
be called heat-watch-api

Change-Id: I092f22d828727b1ebe5e8600776a0c940b6a5222
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix for DB error in Cisco plugin

Bug #1052295

When the Cisco plugin is configured to support the L3 extension, the L3 DB
model is not getting loaded correctly. Adding this import fixes that issue.

Change-Id: I90edece4862e4474e2903f15c29e109fced148a9

commit_message:
Allows waiting timers in libvirt to raise NotFound

There are cases where an operation will fail when communicating with
libvirt. We were eating the exception even though the operation
failed, which has the potential to put the instance into an
unrecoverable state.

This patch allows NotFound exceptions to propogate up so that they
are caught by the state handling code and the task state can be
set to error.

Fixes bug 1002814

Change-Id: Iddc319b24aee0b7132155f50b9d3b0eee9bb3fa8

[{'created': '2012-09-14 21:40:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add admin actions extension

The optional os-admin-actions extension adds new wsgi_actions to the
volumes/action resource and a new snapshots/action endpoint.

With this extension both controllers will support an os-reset_status
action to force a database update of a volume or snapshot that is stuck
in a failed/incorrect status. The os-reset_status action works
similarly to the compute api's os-reset_state action for instances.

The os-force_delete action behaves similarly to the "cinder-manage
volume delete" command and allows operators/admins to retry the delete
operation after it has gone into an error_deleting status with an admin
api call.

The os-admin-actions extension is enabled by default, but limited to the
admin api by the default policy.json rules. Individual admin actions
can be disabled with policy rules as well.

Example of os-reset_status action on a volume:

curl http://localhost:8776/v1/${PROJECT_ID}/volumes/${VOLUME_ID}/action \
    -H "x-auth-token: ${ADMIN_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    -H 'content-type: application/json' \
    -d '{"os-reset_status": {"status": "error"}}'

The new admin only api can assist deployers who encounter bugs or
operational issues that result in failed actions.

It can also be used by future storage backends to support async callback
style status updates from long running actions or operations which have
encountered an error will be retried.

Also updates the api.openstack.wsgi.ControllerMetaclass to support
sub-classing wsgi.Controllers that define wsgi_actions.

Partial fix for bug #1039706

Change-Id: If795599d5150dea362279d75a75276f3166d0149
'}]
commit_message:
Add admin actions extension

The optional os-admin-actions extension adds new wsgi_actions to the
volumes/action resource and a new snapshots/action endpoint.

With this extension both controllers will support an os-reset_status
action to force a database update of a volume or snapshot that is stuck
in a failed/incorrect status. The os-reset_status action works
similarly to the compute api's os-reset_state action for instances.

The os-force_delete action behaves similarly to the "cinder-manage
volume delete" command and allows operators/admins to retry the delete
operation after it has gone into an error_deleting status with an admin
api call.

The os-admin-actions extension is enabled by default, but limited to the
admin api by the default policy.json rules. Individual admin actions
can be disabled with policy rules as well.

Example of os-reset_status action on a volume:

curl http://localhost:8776/v1/${PROJECT_ID}/volumes/${VOLUME_ID}/action \
    -H "x-auth-token: ${ADMIN_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    -H 'content-type: application/json' \
    -d '{"os-reset_status": {"status": "error"}}'

The new admin only api can assist deployers who encounter bugs or
operational issues that result in failed actions.

It can also be used by future storage backends to support async callback
style status updates from long running actions or operations which have
encountered an error will be retried.

Also updates the api.openstack.wsgi.ControllerMetaclass to support
sub-classing wsgi.Controllers that define wsgi_actions.

Partial fix for bug #1039706

Change-Id: If795599d5150dea362279d75a75276f3166d0149

[{'created': '2012-07-28 16:03:30.000000000', 'message': 'Include volume_metadata with object on vol create

Fix for Bug 1029762

The symptom of this bug is that the response data of an
OSAPI create call always shows and empty dict for volume_metadata
regardless of what was passed in to created and actually used.

Upon the db create_volume call a reference to the volume
object is all that was being returned.  Since metadata is
specified and set, it should also be returned with the
create reference object.

This will result in the the osapi create call returning
a body with correct metdata info rather than always showing
and empty dict as it was previously.

commit_message:
Include volume_metadata with object on vol create

Fix for Bug 1029762

The symptom of this bug is that the response data of an
OSAPI create call always shows and empty dict for volume_metadata
regardless of what was passed in to created and actually used.

Upon the db create_volume call a reference to the volume
object is all that was being returned.  Since metadata is
specified and set, it should also be returned with the
create reference object.

This will result in the the osapi create call returning
a body with correct metdata info rather than always showing
and empty dict as it was previously.

Change-Id: I469e06941f446526bae39168f3b1ebfea851e0ef

commit_message:
Add man pages

Add partially written manpages for:
* nova-all
* nova-api-ec2
* nova-api-metadata
* nova-api-os-compute
* nova-api-os-volume
* nova-api
* nova-cert
* nova-compute
* nova-console
* nova-consoleauth
* nova-dhcpbridge
* nova-network
* nova-novncproxy
* nova-objectstore
* nova-rootwrap
* nova-rpc-zmq-receiver
* nova-scheduler
* nova-volume-usage-audit
* nova-volume
* nova-xvpvncproxy

Change-Id: I3734831ce2f6b5d765e98b3f50fe8c1ad7965685

commit_message:
Add filesystem store driver to new func testing

This also fixes bug 1050098. In order to match the existing functional
store test, the filesystem backend needed to be returning the actual
image size.

Change-Id: If202a52a6d303ca2d07fd3abb7f9ac7fe009690e

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-31 11:21:04.000000000', 'message': "Fixes lp:1026190 - Refactor Volumes client

This change adds Cinder support.
Moves the volumes client into it's own directory. Splits it into a Volumes
client for API requests to a Nova Volume (n-vol) API service or Cinder service
(default port: 8776), and a VolumesExtensions client for API requests to the
Compute Extensions for Volume(default port: 8774).

* Keeps existing tests for Compute Extensions as is in tempest/tests/compute
* Copies the tests for n-vol and cinder but using the VolumesClient into
tempest/tests/volume
* Note that to date the Nova Volume API and Cinder API for basic Volumes CRUD
are identical
* Expects future tests for Cinder to go to tempest/tests/volume
and tests for Compute Extensions for volume into the existing
tempest/tests/compute

Change-Id: I14d980ada1ddb29e8147f990aaf239fdcaae5eb6
"}, {'created': '2012-08-01 11:19:59.000000000', 'message': "Fixes lp:1026190 - Refactor Volumes client

commit_message:
Adds Cinder client

This change adds Cinder client in services/volume

* Keeps existing tests for Compute Extensions in tempest/tests/compute
* Copies existing volumes test to tests/volume and refactors them to test the
Cinder API, and adds a BaseVolumesTest class
* Renames the Nova Extensions' volumes_client to volumes_extensions_client
* Adds build_interval and build_timeout parameters in config for Cinder
specific tests
* Renames build_interval and build_timeout environment variables in the
Devstack template file to COMPUTE_BUILD_INTERVAL and COMPUTE_BUILD_TIMEOUT
* Adds volume specific environment variables VOLUME_BUILD_INTERVAL AND
VOLUME_BUILD_TIMEOUT to the Devstack template file.

Fixes LP Bug #1026190

Change-Id: I14d980ada1ddb29e8147f990aaf239fdcaae5eb6

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-17 20:56:35.000000000', 'message': 'Reset the task state after backup done.

The compute manager needs to reset the task state after a backup
is complete. However it was only correctly reseting after a
snapshot due to the current expected state being hardcoded.
Now looks for the correct expected state depending on whether a
backup or snapshot was being executed.

Fixes bug 1051069

Change-Id: Ie91f7745b98232370be6c99d318a8033a93cc50c
'}]
commit_message:
Reset the task state after backup done.

The compute manager needs to reset the task state after a backup
is complete. However it was only correctly reseting after a
snapshot due to the current expected state being hardcoded.
Now looks for the correct expected state depending on whether a
backup or snapshot was being executed.

Fixes bug 1051069

Change-Id: Ie91f7745b98232370be6c99d318a8033a93cc50c

commit_message:
Includes sec group quota details in limits API response

Added the security groups quota details to
the limit API response so that these details
also get displayed to the user.

Fixes bug 1049578
Change-Id: I45c345141747f99359c8948e959030f8cb99e866

Fixes setup compatibility issue on Windows

Fixes Bug #1052161

"python setup.py build" fails on Windows due to a hardcoded shell path:
/bib/sh

commit_message:
Rework so that backing options passthrough to child.

When a new qcow2 image is created with a backing file ensure
that we passthrough some (not all) of the options that the
backing file could of been created with. Also canonicalize
the qemu img keys so that there is a standard way of looking
them up that does not involve spaces and dashes...

Blueprint backing-file-options

Change-Id: I495a913b9d24694e50bd6acd2106f77abad496b1

commit_message:
Include Schedule Hints deserialization to XML API

So far the xml format to schedule hints were not defined.
Once defined (in ML), this patch add support to its deserialization.

This patch also includes a xml deserialization method to get the Elements
between the childs of a node.

Partially fixes bug 1050997

Change-Id: I2a34dbbd6200755818d7eaa7330a96d61a043614

commit_message:
Improve entity validation in volumes APIs

Fixes bug #1048565

Use the new Controller.is_valid_body() helper to validate the entity
body in various volumes related POST/PUT handlers and return 422
as appropriate.

(Cherry picks commit dcecb586 from Cinder and adds similar fixes for
the volumes bits in the compute API)

Change-Id: I04127972981522c1ed81903893396c4f9665bcd3

[{'created': '2012-09-17 16:58:39.000000000', 'message': "Update quota when deleting volume that failed to be scheduled

If one volume was failed to get scheduled, removing such volume should
also clean up reservation.
Also when create_volume is ready to send to scheduler, reservation
should be committed no matter backend can successfully create that
volume or not since deleting volume call will do a minus reservation
even on volume with 'error' status.

Fix bug 1052052

Change-Id: Iaec9926024ad5adb38b08b07772095f49b8593c2
"}]
commit_message:
Update quota when deleting volume that failed to be scheduled

If one volume was failed to get scheduled, removing such volume should
also clean up reservation.
Also when create_volume is ready to send to scheduler, reservation
should be committed no matter backend can successfully create that
volume or not since deleting volume call will do a minus reservation
even on volume with 'error' status.

Fix bug 1052052

Change-Id: Iaec9926024ad5adb38b08b07772095f49b8593c2

commit_message:
Add requirements for Jenkins Transifex jobs.

The Jenkins jobs that pull translations from Transifex and push changes
to Gerrit rely on Babel being preconfigured to work with distutils. Add
this configuration to Horizon's setup.py. Also, add an additional
horizon.pot file for use in the jobs.

Fixes bug #1050807

Change-Id: I08c8161741fb39de8884a113c66be63c67ddf143

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-17 20:02:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix backtrace when using loadbalancer

Loadbalancer incorrectly tried to reference a string as an integer.

This resulted in the following typeerror which is repaired by
thi patch:

    timeout_check = 'timeout check %ds' % (health_chk['Timeout'])
TypeError: %d format: a number is required, not unicode

Fixes issue #240

Change-Id: I7e2697200d3fa9b0cb009f3a7898d487b70fc23a
Signed-off-by: Steven Dake <sdake@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix backtrace when using loadbalancer

Loadbalancer incorrectly tried to reference a string as an integer.

This resulted in the following typeerror which is repaired by
thi patch:

    timeout_check = 'timeout check %ds' % (health_chk['Timeout'])
TypeError: %d format: a number is required, not unicode

Fixes issue #240

Change-Id: I7e2697200d3fa9b0cb009f3a7898d487b70fc23a
Signed-off-by: Steven Dake <sdake@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add non-verbose output mode

Set VERBOSE=False to turn off the noise of stack.sh output.  All
output still is written to the logfile if LOGFILE is set.

Rebased

Change-Id: I316bc4d68c997ec907a48e720e2f7778428d935b

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-14 19:10:24.000000000', 'message': 'Change qpid_heartbeat default.

The default value of qpid_heartbeat of 5 seconds is unnecessarily
aggressive.  Change it to 60 seconds to reduce the possibility of
getting disconnected from qpidd under normal circumstances.

Fix bug 1050661.

Change-Id: I9525e74f96314c2c9183d6b10cf503936c81f589
'}]
commit_message:
Change qpid_heartbeat default.

The default value of qpid_heartbeat of 5 seconds is unnecessarily
aggressive.  Change it to 60 seconds to reduce the possibility of
getting disconnected from qpidd under normal circumstances.

Fix bug 1050661.

Change-Id: I9525e74f96314c2c9183d6b10cf503936c81f589

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-11 20:17:51.000000000', 'message': "Remove the persistent tgt files via unstack.sh

  Now that we're using persistent targets folks wanting
  to unstack and start over are surprised to find their
  old targets come back after restarting the service.

  This adds a rm -rf to the default persistent tgt file directory
  to truly clean up the installation.

Change-Id: I3ba9f2b8c099c7f290696760527fe2147d9b1d38
"}, {'created': '2012-09-11 21:16:52.000000000', 'message': "Remove the persistent tgt files via unstack.sh

  Now that we're using persistent targets folks wanting
  to unstack and start over are surprised to find their
  old targets come back after restarting the service.

  This adds a rm -rf to the default persistent tgt file directory
  to truly clean up the installation.

  Also, let's explicitly delete all of the targets
  when we run unstack.sh so we don't have confusing
  messages going by regarding targets that are present.

Change-Id: I3ba9f2b8c099c7f290696760527fe2147d9b1d38
"}, {'created': '2012-09-11 21:33:16.000000000', 'message': "Remove the persistent tgt files via unstack.sh

  Now that we're using persistent targets folks wanting
  to unstack and start over are surprised to find their
  old targets come back after restarting the service.

  This adds a rm -rf to the default persistent tgt file directory
  to truly clean up the installation.

  Also, let's explicitly delete all of the targets
  when we run unstack.sh so we don't have confusing
  messages going by regarding targets that are present.

Change-Id: I3ba9f2b8c099c7f290696760527fe2147d9b1d38
"}, {'created': '2012-09-11 23:05:17.000000000', 'message': 'Enhance tgt cleanup in unstack.sh

commit_message:
Enhance tgt cleanup in unstack.sh

  *Check that tgt driver is in good state when we start
   if not try to just restart it

  *Remove targets based on iqn entries in persist files

  *Remove the persist files themeselves

  *Stop the tgt service

Updated to use *_STATE_DIR vars

Change-Id: I3ba9f2b8c099c7f290696760527fe2147d9b1d38

commit_message:
Document VMs with disks stored in LVM

Add description for options related to feature of LVM backed
instances in libvirt driver. Explicitly specify, that current
implementation of snapshotting works only with Qcow2 backed instances.

This resolves bug 1027606

Change-Id: Idef54b27478026760cb99131ea1bc21f5ee53afc

commit_message:
Add a note about metadata case senstivity in swift

fixes bug 939982

As in the bug report, the Swift interface uses HTTP which has no
case sensitivity. This patch adds a note to remind users not to
expect it.

Change-Id: I6b1bcae84bea40d17b062f1d98bb465766c5c3b9

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-16 10:25:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix generate/import keypair example in API doc

fixes bug 1020614

As per the bug report, the example in the keypairs extension
was incorrect. If the optional public key is specified (i.e. a
keypair import), a private key will not be returned.

The most common case is to specify only a name and get back a
full keypair, so this patch modifies the examples to portray this.

Change-Id: I9c8f2269ee5374ef609a91bbc938066363a033cd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix generate/import keypair example in API doc

fixes bug 1020614

As per the bug report, the example in the keypairs extension
was incorrect. If the optional public key is specified (i.e. a
keypair import), a private key will not be returned.

The most common case is to specify only a name and get back a
full keypair, so this patch modifies the examples to portray this.

Change-Id: I9c8f2269ee5374ef609a91bbc938066363a033cd

commit_message:
Deserialize user_data in xml servers request

Also adds better validation for b64 encoded data since python
will happily ignore illegal bytes in the base64 encoded data.

Fixes bug 1050797

Change-Id: I4f380d029ec2d51f130a6dbd581410873e414216

commit_message:
Clean up handling of project_only in network_get

There was some funky logic for getting networks to work around
the project only decorator. This changes the code to match what
we actually want which is:

In Flat and FlatDHCP mode non-admins should be able to access
networks that belong to their project or networks that have no
project_id assigned.

In VlanManager, project_id=None projects should not be accessible
as this means the project hasn't been assigned yet. The assignment
is done with an elevated context.

This patch adds some logic to model_query to allow None in the
project_only filter and makes network_get_all_by_uuids and
network_get use it.

fixes bug 1048869

Change-Id: I5377cea87dec8e9d0d9cec84e07128c5c6e8dca3

[{'created': '2012-09-17 17:45:53.000000000', 'message': 'Normalize_time() always return naive object

Currently the timeutils.normalize_time() returns naive datetime
object when parameter timestamp is an naive object or a non-UTC
aware datetime object, and returns aware datetime object if
parameter timestamp is a UTC aware datetime object.

The basic problem here is that utcoffset() of None means the object is naive
but a utcoffset() of zero means that the object is aware but represents
UTC time.

This is fragile implementation and will trigger potential issue, because
aware/native datetime is not interoperatable. For example,
"timeutils.utcnow() > timeutils.normalize_time(m)" will success at most
time, while trigger TypeError if m is a UTC aware object.

We want to normalize all objects into naive objects.

Fixes bug 1048636

Change-Id: I4a09246fa8f0dd63ca54362b877aa825d9b79772
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
'}, {'created': '2012-09-17 17:45:53.000000000', 'message': 'Normalize_time() always return naive object

object when parameter timestamp is an naive object or a non-UTC

parameter timestamp is a UTC aware datttime object.

This is fragile implementation and will trigger potential issue, because
aware/native datetime is not interoperatable. For example,
"timeutils.utcnow() > timeutils.normalize_time(m)" will success at most
time, while trigger TypeError if m is a UTC aware object.

Fixes bug 1048636

Change-Id: I4a09246fa8f0dd63ca54362b877aa825d9b79772
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Normalize_time() always return naive object

Currently the timeutils.normalize_time() returns naive datetime
object when parameter timestamp is an naive object or a non-UTC
aware datetime object, and returns aware datetime object if
parameter timestamp is a UTC aware datetime object.

The basic problem here is that utcoffset() of None means the object is naive
but a utcoffset() of zero means that the object is aware but represents
UTC time.

This is fragile implementation and will trigger potential issue, because
aware/native datetime is not interoperatable. For example,
"timeutils.utcnow() > timeutils.normalize_time(m)" will success at most
time, while trigger TypeError if m is a UTC aware object.

We want to normalize all objects into naive objects.

Fixes bug 1048636

Change-Id: I4a09246fa8f0dd63ca54362b877aa825d9b79772
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-13 21:11:18.000000000', 'message': 'Yield to another greenthread when some time-consuming task finished.

Partially addresses bug #1045152

On a heavily loaded compute node, it can be observed that periodic tasks
take so long to run that the report_state() looping call can be blocked from
running long enough that the scheduler thinks the host is dead.

Reduce the chance of this happening by yielding to another greenthread
after each periodic task has completed and each loop in some methods
that has linear relationship with the number of instances.

Change-Id: If2b125708da8298b20497e2e08e52280c102f1e1
'}]
commit_message:
Yield to another greenthread when some time-consuming task finished.

Partially addresses bug #1045152

On a heavily loaded compute node, it can be observed that periodic tasks
take so long to run that the report_state() looping call can be blocked from
running long enough that the scheduler thinks the host is dead.

Reduce the chance of this happening by yielding to another greenthread
after each periodic task has completed and each loop in some methods
that has linear relationship with the number of instances.

Change-Id: If2b125708da8298b20497e2e08e52280c102f1e1

commit_message:
Split instance polling code

This just split the polling code for one instance out of the periodic task
function to be able to use this code for only one instance.

Change-Id: I4ec0ab3870410f0b6c7e44857a9dede60fb6d50b
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Fix XML deserialization of rebuild parameters

This picks up the following attributes which are currently ignored
when poking this via XML:
 - accessIPv4
 - accessIPv6
 - adminPass

Change-Id: I947aa2f942022d839919ae7516759955e5b06668

commit_message:
Make compute/manager.py use self.host instead of FLAGS.host

This prevents the instances returned from getting a different
instance['host'] than was supplied to the manager. This shows up
during integrated testing of 'resize'.

Change-Id: Ifa4316bf7099dc2c60c4e87cfaafa93a4bc2e5b1

commit_message:
heat : Show user parameter values in heat describe

Return an agregate set of stack parameters via heat describe
and underlying engine show_stack call, so we see the template
parameters, and any user-overridden values (ie don't just show
the template defaults, which is not really very useful)

Fixes #238

Change-Id: Ia2cc3271f0dcf8c986e968bc21775d31ecbe6228
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Adds functionality to the APISampleTestBase class

Makes it possible to define additional regexes needed for verifying
API responses in one place in derived classes, in order to avoid
code repetition in every test method.

Change-Id: Ia871d472837d5c8ee9cb988c718f2b8b462df9e2

- http://logs.openstack.org/11915/3/check/gate-glance-pep8/2269 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11915/3/check/gate-glance-python26/1776 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11915/3/check/gate-glance-python27/1788 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11915/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/10732 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11915/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/713 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2012-09-07 12:39:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

FWIW I pushed this change up as a 'nice to have', but looking at multi-process bug 1042823 it struck me that the current code is not printing the pid in a lot of cases, eg the wsgi stuff:

 2012-09-06 16:25:06 INFO eventlet.wsgi.server [-] Starting 1 workers

this makes supporting Glance (in terms of figuring out what's happening on your machine) much more difficult than in Diablo/Essex where the pid was always available. With this patch I could see a pid in *every* line of log output, which helped me hugely in finding the root cause.

I wonder if this strengthens the case for including this change in Folsom?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-09-07 15:40:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I do agree this is an improvement, but how big of a risk do you think there is to breaking existing log parsers that depend on the pid at the end of the line?'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2012-09-07 18:24:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I wonder if putting it in now may be less disruptive.

From a Glance point of view, the new logging style hasn't been in that long (weeks), so the risk may be quite low.

In contrast if we wait, then the old format will be in the
wild for longer (~six months), and any new or existing log parser will expect it. Both new and existing parsers will then be tripped up when this change goes in.

But its a judgement call and I'm ok with holding off if you think that's best."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-09-07 19:46:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Ok, so that is a great point. We already changed the logging format for Folsom by switching to the common log module.

Let's go ahead with this - however, we can't carry changes to the common module in Glance. You'll need to land this change upstream in openstack-common."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-09-12 20:21:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I pushed up some reviews that pull in your code from openstack-common. I think you can abandon this review now.

master: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12849/
milestone-proposed: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12850/'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2012-09-17 10:08:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

Change went into openstack-common, so can abandon here.'}]

commit_message:
Change logging of process id

Move process id to a fixed position in the logs to
make it easier to trace log entries on a per-process
basis.

Fix for LP bug 1040772.

Change-Id: I255bf6b66e2bb86fe10b9ae8a881a361772a396e

commit_message:
Use openstack.common.timeutils.isotime()

Remove heat_utils.strftime() and replace callers with
openstack.common.timeutils.isotime().  They do similar activites, and
since its carried in common, makes more sense to use that version.

Change-Id: Icd919fb218a5f97be103eda7814a5fb56e1b0a02
Signed-off-by: Steven Dake <sdake@redhat.com>

subject: Set ssh port configurable when do migration.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-16 09:49:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- http://logs.openstack.org/13067/1/check/gate-nova-merge/8727 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13067/1/check/gate-nova-docs/4525 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13067/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/9837 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13067/1/check/gate-nova-python26/5985 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13067/1/check/gate-nova-python27/6047 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/13067/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/11745 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13067/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/1725 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13067/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/868 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-09-16 10:11:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

While the patch is fine I'm generally worried about exposing stuff like this as a config variable. ssh has _lots_ of options, where does it stop?"}, {'account_id': 1082, 'date': '2012-09-16 15:57:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Perhaps instead of adding options to this ssh one by one, we could just add one named 'migration_ssh_config', that defaulted to None, and thus would not use a specific config.

Then, if not None, '-F <config_file>' would always be passed to ssh."}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-09-16 23:42:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Good suggestion Scott. While a bit more awkward, it's a lot more general."}, {'account_id': 1678, 'date': '2012-09-17 01:58:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That's great.
So we can just put ssh config into /home/nova/.ssh/config (the default user nova-compute used is 'nova').
And doesn't need any modification in code, it works!"}, {'account_id': 1678, 'date': '2012-09-17 02:02:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Just put ssh config into /home/nova/.ssh/config (the default user nova-compute used is 'nova'). And doesn't need any modification in code."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-16 09:33:26.000000000', 'message': 'Set ssh port configurable when do migration.

The ssh port sometimes is not 22. So make it configurable will be good.

Change-Id: If5bef0bcd80a3eb970457fc7669614e41ca34843
'}]
commit_message:
Set ssh port configurable when do migration.

The ssh port sometimes is not 22. So make it configurable will be good.

Change-Id: If5bef0bcd80a3eb970457fc7669614e41ca34843

This is really a client issue, it should handle a well-formed URL whether it ends in a slash or not.  I know I patched the swift client long ago for this very problem. commit_message:
Work around nova-network launch issue

Launch nova-network *after* nova-cert to work around the SELinux error in
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=857747

Change-Id: I2ca4af4b950cca92cdd2785c493d8453648ccbb0
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

I see no change on master with the same Change-Id:
That needs to happen first, and then you can cherry-pick -x
to the stable branch. It's fine to copy this Change-Id: for
the master branch.

Also you should add this to the bottom of the commit message,
so that the automatic bug updating and correlation happens.

    Fixes bug: 1040255

thanks!"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-09-08 08:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Oh sorry I see this is a separate change to master.
There are also now separate but very related bugs.
What I'd do is:

1. Click the "nominate for series" button towards the top of bug 1040537
2. Amend the commit message of this change to add at the bottom: Fixes bug: 1040537

Then everything should be correlated and easily traceable

thanks.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-16 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Cisco plugin for create/delete/update network operations. The exceptions
were occurring on account of the recent changes in the OVS module to the

'}]
commit_message:
Fix for failing network operations in Cisco plugin

Bug #1050545

This fixes the exceptions occurring in the virtual switch mode of the
Cisco plugin for create/delete/update network operations. The exceptions
were occurring on account of the recent changes in the OVS module to the
get_vlan and get_vlans methods, which were still being invoked here.
Test configuration has been changed to increase the code coverage to
catch such issues in the future. All changes are limited to the Cisco
plugin and related tests.

Change-Id: Id18473f7a9a2a22217a59b4f8b1541b4918e07e7

commit_message:
NOVA_INSTANCES_PATH was being set to devstack dir

  After change ID If95dc19b the NOVA_INSTANCES_PATH was being set incorrectly.
  The result was that when the instances cleanup section of stack.sh was executed
  it resulted in deletion of the devstack directory causing the install to puke.

Change-Id: I36fb85041cf8357d5095e494db66e2775dbc1199

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-15 14:19:07.000000000', 'message': 'Change rpc cleanup to occur before killing engine thread

This bug only manifested itself after a heat request was made to the
engine. Once a request was made a Qpid connection handler continued
to wait in a select call, presumably for a subsequent request. Closing
the connection immediately after detecting a keyboard interrupt and then
terminating the thread yields a clean shutdown with no traceback.

Closes #176

Change-Id: Ifdb82d33a6c52a004bbd6b08c564264f4140e800
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Change rpc cleanup to occur before killing engine thread

This bug only manifested itself after a heat request was made to the
engine. Once a request was made a Qpid connection handler continued
to wait in a select call, presumably for a subsequent request. Closing
the connection immediately after detecting a keyboard interrupt and then
terminating the thread yields a clean shutdown with no traceback.

Closes #176

Change-Id: Ifdb82d33a6c52a004bbd6b08c564264f4140e800
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-11 19:23:04.000000000', 'message': 'workaround lack of quantum/nova floatingip integration

bug 1040956

The Nova/Quantum integration in Folsom does not yet proxy Nova
floating IP calls to Quantum.  However, Horizon automatically
makes calls to Nova to list floating IPs, which prior to this
patch resulted in a Horizon error message due to the fact that
the Quantum integration code in Nova would raise an Unimplemented
error.  This patch changes that behavior to instead return an
empty list.

This is a workaround for Folsom.  The correct long-term behavior
is either to:
1) have Nova proxy all floating-ip calls to Quantum when quantum
is enabled.
2) have Horizon use the Quantum floating-ip API when Quantum
is enabled.

Change-Id: I5414d935e872a9da108511b50e70545d82b73347
'}]
commit_message:
workaround lack of quantum/nova floatingip integration

bug 1040956

The Nova/Quantum integration in Folsom does not yet proxy Nova
floating IP calls to Quantum.  However, Horizon automatically
makes calls to Nova to list floating IPs, which prior to this
patch resulted in a Horizon error message due to the fact that
the Quantum integration code in Nova would raise an Unimplemented
error.  This patch changes that behavior to instead return an
empty list.

This is a workaround for Folsom.  The correct long-term behavior
is either to:
1) have Nova proxy all floating-ip calls to Quantum when quantum
is enabled.
2) have Horizon use the Quantum floating-ip API when Quantum
is enabled.

Change-Id: I5414d935e872a9da108511b50e70545d82b73347

commit_message:
Corrects use of instance_uuid for fixed ip

Uses instance_uuid rather than instance_id since commit 66f9e085a.

Fixes bug 1050417.

Change-Id: I6161c7a6ad9c3891e100daae39fe8ea82bfd8654

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-04 09:59:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-04 10:00:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

It's really not clear to me here what the actual bug is

I also think that the real fix is to not use a read_deleted context so liberally in nova.network.manager

See bug #1038266 for a similar bug

e.g. how to reproduce it? What commands did the user run that are behaving incorrectly?"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-04 10:01:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For reference, a lot of the read_deleted usage came from Ib24fea0701cf640721cd0b021c78c8c5dfbb507b'}, {'account_id': 819, 'date': '2012-09-04 12:35:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I don't know what actual bug this could cause, but I think there are potential issues if we leave the code as is. That's my understanding:

The floating_ip_get_by_address() method returns only one floating IP (.first()). If there are two floating IPs with the same address in the database, one of the two being deleted, floating_ip_get_by_address() should return the one that is not deleted. Without setting read_deleted="no" in model_query(), the method could return either one of the two IPs.

To answer:
> The question is, why are we calling the method with a read_deleted context if we don't want deleted IPs?
I think that it wouldn't make sense to call floating_ip_get_by_address() with read_deleted="yes" context. In such case, when there are multiple floating IPs with the same address, one really existing and the others being deleted, what should be returned?

So I agree we should fix calls to floating_ip_get_by_address() currently using read_deleted="yes" context (if any) to use "no", but nonetheless the method floating_ip_get_by_address() itself should behave correctly in both read_deleted="yes" and "no" contexts. Its current behavior in the read_deleted="yes" context makes no sense to me.'}, {'account_id': 819, 'date': '2012-09-04 14:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 819, 'date': '2012-09-04 14:58:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-04 15:21:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-09-05 05:08:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Read deleted defaults to no, I don't like overriding the context if it is specified that it should be yes. It would be better to find the case where you have a read deleted context set to yes and you don't want to read deleted floating ips and set it back to no. I had to make some changes to do this here: https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/1f98e28a so if there are more places we should change them."}, {'account_id': 819, 'date': '2012-09-05 13:28:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 819, 'date': '2012-09-05 13:32:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

It makes no sense to call this method with read_deleted="yes", and currently can lead to inconsistent result.

I added a new test case to show how floating_ip_get_by_address() may return different results in a read_deleted="yes" context depending on the order the floating IPs were added to the database initially. That seems really wrong.

Agreed we should ensure that existing calls to floating_ip_get_by_address() are not using a read_deleted="yes" context, but if we also add a safeguard in the method itself, it'd prevent future misuse of the method (i.e. call from read_deleted="yes" context). Is there any drawback in doing this?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-05 13:54:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

The code seems to do what you say, but indeed more information is needed in the bug: how to reproduce it and what precisely could go wrong.'}, {'account_id': 819, 'date': '2012-09-07 13:32:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

As I said already, I don't know of actual problems caused by this bug. Just looking at the code, I didn't find find anything but I may be wrong.

The goal of my change is to make sure no real problem arises in case we are missing something now, or in case someone adds an incorrect call to floating_ip_get_by_address() (with read_deleted="yes" context) in the future.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-09-07 18:39:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

If there is no real issue I am against merging this. The whole point of controlling read_deleted in the context is to allow callers to get deleted values if they want deleted. You are making it safer for some cases but removing functionality for others. If the caller is doing something risky like setting read_deleted = 'yes' in the context we should respect it."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-15 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Filter deleted IPs in floating_ip_get_by_address()

In a read_deleted='yes' context, floating_ip_get_by_address() wasn't
filtering out deleted floating IPs which could result in a wrong IP
being returned.

Fixes: bug #1044108
Change-Id: Icb440a12866be5685ebbd3067f89ae1e6f89b276

commit_message:
add missing files from setup.py

Fixes bug 1050045.

Currently, setup.py will not copy l3_agent.ini and rootwrap filters
into directory /etc/quantum. Add copy operation in setup.py for those
config files so that those files will be copied into proper directory.

Change-Id: I7052d6c07ffd4d03cafa93187d8072053ee0a832

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-14 12:51:57.000000000', 'message': "All security groups not returned to admins by default.

Fixes bug 1046054.

Previously security groups relating to all tenants were returned
when requested by an admin user.

Now only those groups related to the current tenant are returned
by default.

To recover the old behaviour, the all_tenants search option may
be specified via the native API with:

  /v2/<project_id>/os-security-groups?all_tenants=1

or via the EC2 API with:

  Action=DescribeSecurityGroups&Filter.1.Name=all-tenants&Filter.1.Value.1=1

Note that the latter is slightly ultra vires with respect to the
EC2 API spec, in the sense that this filter is in addition to the
standard set. Since we don't pay attention to many of these standard
filters as yet, this stepping slightly off-piste is deemed worth it.

Change-Id: I6157e408394d04096d21747d665e3b3aa6aa55de
"}]
commit_message:
All security groups not returned to admins by default.

Fixes bug 1046054.

Previously security groups relating to all tenants were returned
when requested by an admin user.

Now only those groups related to the current tenant are returned
by default.

To recover the old behaviour, the all_tenants search option may
be specified via the native API with:

  /v2/<project_id>/os-security-groups?all_tenants=1

or via the EC2 API with:

  Action=DescribeSecurityGroups&Filter.1.Name=all-tenants&Filter.1.Value.1=1

Note that the latter is slightly ultra vires with respect to the
EC2 API spec, in the sense that this filter is in addition to the
standard set. Since we don't pay attention to many of these standard
filters as yet, this stepping slightly off-piste is deemed worth it.

Change-Id: I6157e408394d04096d21747d665e3b3aa6aa55de

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-12 11:55:04.000000000', 'message': "Remove useless _get_key_name() in servers API

This no longer does anything useful. Firstly, we already check that the
body dict has a server key. Secondly, AttributeError will never be
thrown here since we have already checked that the entity is a dict.
Finally, we don't need to set this key to None if it's not supplied
by the client since we later use get() to to look it up.

Change-Id: I4235117cc47e5b5cbdad4425edb3c7059e608d49
"}, {'created': '2012-09-13 15:13:20.000000000', 'message': "Remove useless _get_key_name() in servers API

This no longer does anything useful. Firstly, we already check that the
body dict has a server key. Secondly, AttributeError will never be
thrown here since we have already checked that the entity is a dict.
Finally, we don't need to set this key to None if it's not supplied
by the client since we later use get() to to look it up.

Change-Id: I4235117cc47e5b5cbdad4425edb3c7059e608d49
"}]
commit_message:
Remove useless _get_key_name() in servers API

This no longer does anything useful. Firstly, we already check that the
body dict has a server key. Secondly, AttributeError will never be
thrown here since we have already checked that the entity is a dict.
Finally, we don't need to set this key to None if it's not supplied
by the client since we later use get() to to look it up.

Change-Id: I4235117cc47e5b5cbdad4425edb3c7059e608d49

Add a _valid_body() helper for the servers API to avoid repeating the
same tests in multiple methods. Include a check that the 'server' value
is actually a dict.

Also remove the superfluous checking of req.body which is a leftover
from when the body wasn't a method parameter.

Change-Id: If8114cc76d68567005c85c803f29e30e034db89a
"}, {'created': '2012-09-13 15:13:22.000000000', 'message': "Add entity body validation helper

Add a _valid_body() helper for the servers API to avoid repeating the
same tests in multiple methods. Include a check that the 'server' value
is actually a dict.

Also remove the superfluous checking of req.body which is a leftover

commit_message:
Add entity body validation helper

Add a _valid_body() helper for the servers API to avoid repeating the
same tests in multiple methods. Include a check that the 'server' value
is actually a dict.

Also remove the superfluous checking of req.body which is a leftover
from when the body wasn't a method parameter.

Change-Id: If8114cc76d68567005c85c803f29e30e034db89a

I have two concerns:

1) If the linuxbridge agent has moved the host's IP address to the bridge, simply removing the bridge without moving the IP address back to the interface will break the host's network connectivity.

2) In my testing, the bridges were deleted by unstack.sh, but several tap devices remained. Also, two network namespaces remained, containing loopback devices. Shouldn't all of this get cleaned up?"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-12 15:50:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-12 16:09:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

It either needs to move the host IP address back to the physical interface, or just skip deleting that bridge."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-12 18:23:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Bob, I di dnot see the comments hence no response.
1. Namespaces - there is a utility to destroy the namespaces. This has yet to be integrated into devstack. This is not part of the scope of this patch
2. I am not sure that I follow regarding the comment about the bridge. As far as I understand this is only when the user will create a flat network. Maybe I have missed something here.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-09-12 19:12:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Fair enough on the scope regarding namespaces.

And yes, I am talking (mainly) about bridges for flat networks. On systems that do not support tunneling, when the devstack user does not have control of a set of VLANs trunked between their test machines, flat networks are the only option (kind of like FlatDHCPManager in Nova Networking). I believe the cleanup function needs to either move the IP address back to the interface or else skip deleting that bridge.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-13 17:57:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-13 17:58:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Quantum enhancements

1. Calls agent binaries instead of agent files directly
2. Updates for l3 agent with linuxbridge
3. Uses LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver for OVS

Change-Id: I442aee913e515a8af75ac3539be4937c5d9da9fb

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-12 16:00:25.000000000', 'message': "added errno.EINVAL check to fallocate

On some systems (eg Illumos), posix_fallocate() returns
EINVAL when the underlying filesystem doesn't support the
operation. On Linux, the fallocate() call returns
EOPNOTSUPP.

The need for this patch was revealed by Victor Rodionov
<victor.rodionov@nexenta.com>.

Change-Id: I06fa9d49e7ec4084135843b7e0c91948dc098d27
"}]
commit_message:
added errno.EINVAL check to fallocate

On some systems (eg Illumos), posix_fallocate() returns
EINVAL when the underlying filesystem doesn't support the
operation. On Linux, the fallocate() call returns
EOPNOTSUPP.

The need for this patch was revealed by Victor Rodionov
<victor.rodionov@nexenta.com>.

Change-Id: I06fa9d49e7ec4084135843b7e0c91948dc098d27

commit_message:
Allow older versions of libvirt to delete vms

Libvirt < 0.9.4 doesn't support undefineFlags, so the vms can't be
deleted. This patch adds a workaround to fallback to the old style
of undefine if undefineFlags throws an Attribute error. It also
attempts to remove any managed save images that exist.

Fixes bug 1051010

Change-Id: I155fe2ab3be347b1515c5aab4a9233921bd722ca

  default is now /opt/stack/data/nova
* add NOVA_INSTANCES_PATH to move the instances dir separately
  from the state dir
* allow GLANCE_CACHE_DIR to be overridden,
  default is now /opt/stack/data/glance/cache
* allow GLANCE_IMAGE_DIR to be overridden,
  default is inow /opt/stack/data/glance/images
* set GLANCE_BIN_DIR to support entry points (future)
* allow CINDER_STATE_PATH to be overridden,
  default is now /opt/stack/data/cinder

Change-Id: If95dc19b957ef5b9b14397835cd0543f82717f50
'}]
commit_message:
Move Glance data and Nova state dirs out of source dir

* allow NOVA_STATE_PATH to be overridden,
  default is now /opt/stack/data/nova
* add NOVA_INSTANCES_PATH to move the instances dir separately
  from the state dir
* allow GLANCE_CACHE_DIR to be overridden,
  default is now /opt/stack/data/glance/cache
* allow GLANCE_IMAGE_DIR to be overridden,
  default is inow /opt/stack/data/glance/images
* set GLANCE_BIN_DIR to support entry points (future)
* allow CINDER_STATE_PATH to be overridden,
  default is now /opt/stack/data/cinder

Change-Id: If95dc19b957ef5b9b14397835cd0543f82717f50

"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-09-13 22:56:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Joshua.

Replacing the simple command with lots of python that does a similar thing isn't generally desired. Fair enough if it gives greater visibility, but does it? Either the guestmount process exits or it doesn't, what else can you infer?

You're right though that the issue in the logs is less than obvious. We should improve the error along the lines of:

    try:
        # The existing code
    except exception.ProcessExecutionError:
        msg = _("Failed to umount image. "
                "guestmount was still running after 10s")
        raise exception.NovaException(msg)

As for the 10 seconds value. Does increasing it help in your testing? If so we should change that default.
I'd try to avoid a config option if possible, and figure
out the best value to use (why your guestmount is
hanging/slow).

thanks,
Pdraig.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-09-13 23:03:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Current thoughts on this.

Yes it increases visibility, into how long guestfs is typically taking to work correctly with fuse. The amount of python code, sure, understandable that it may be to much. Would u think at least letting the timing be configurable is useful? This should hopefully all go away with cfgdrive, because its a real headache :-P'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-09-13 23:40:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Reworking.'}, {'account_id': 1082, 'date': '2012-09-14 15:52:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

bah. saw "abandoned" after i reviewed.
but the comments might be useful anyway.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-09-14 17:07:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thx scott, good comments anyway (useful to know...) :-)'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-09-14 17:19:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

[{'created': '2012-09-13 22:01:40.000000000', 'message': 'Rework the guestfs unmounting code.

Instead of messing around with a silent and pretty unusual
shell script that tries to wait 0.2 seconds between checks to
see if a process is alive (in a external process) it is much
more useful to have logging around this, doing everything as much
as possible in native python as we can and having useful error
messaging and logging when this situation does occur. This change
tries to make that more possible (and helps track down the root cause).

Change-Id: I71d8df07bb1dcc56ed61234acab2de87aee18f66

commit_message:
Rework the guestfs unmounting code.

Instead of messing around with a silent and pretty unusual
shell script that tries to wait 0.2 seconds between checks to
see if a process is alive (in a external process) it is much
more useful to have logging around this, doing everything as much
as possible in native python as we can and having useful error
messaging and logging when this situation does occur. This change
tries to make that more possible (and helps track down the root cause).

Bug 1050645

Change-Id: I71d8df07bb1dcc56ed61234acab2de87aee18f66

commit_message:
Add support for all-tenants search opt to secgroup-list

Related to bug 1046054.

Once I6157e408 lands, we will be respecting the all-tenants search option
in the security groups retrieval API. Hence the CLI should be capable of
adding this option when appropriate.

Change-Id: If1217a5ffc7316e4661326c38da9b2956424ab05

commit_message:
Add a resume delete on volume manager startup

  Currently if for some reason the volume service was stopped
  during the zero out operation of a volume delete there was
  no way to get the volume removed from the system (it would
  be present in deleting status forever).

  This change adds a simple check of volumes in the DB with status
  of deleting, and if any are found it restarts the delete process
  on them.

  addresses bug #1011150

Change-Id: I6aa26e9eaa94da4b620f01160931cbfcad9dadf7

commit_message:
libvirt: Cleanup L2 and L3 rules when confirm vm resize

Cleanup security group and nwfilter rules on source node in
resize-confirm.

Add test cases for confirm_migration and _cleanup_resize.

Fixes bug 1050196

Change-Id: Id5495c41f3b51aa555a540f2c8aa718b653ae034

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-13 19:15:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for Unicode secgroup names

Fixes bug 934081.

Previously, manipulating secgroups with Unicode names would fail
in _get_secgroup, due to the command-line argument being a raw
byte string, and the secgroup name from cs.security_groups.list()
being a Unicode string.  This causes a UnicodeWarning and the
"if secgroup == s.name" test to fail for the desired secgroup, so
secgroup-add-rule and secgroup-delete would fail.

This change converts them to byte strings for comparison, fixing
these commands.

Likewise, error messages containing Unicode secgroup names would
fail to print. (i.e. "Security group <x> already exists")

Change-Id: Ie90cb49b8f11e3283fe509e95a8e9fd468cc9892
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for Unicode secgroup names

Fixes bug 934081.

Previously, manipulating secgroups with Unicode names would fail
in _get_secgroup, due to the command-line argument being a raw
byte string, and the secgroup name from cs.security_groups.list()
being a Unicode string.  This causes a UnicodeWarning and the
"if secgroup == s.name" test to fail for the desired secgroup, so
secgroup-add-rule and secgroup-delete would fail.

This change converts them to byte strings for comparison, fixing
these commands.

Likewise, error messages containing Unicode secgroup names would
fail to print. (i.e. "Security group <x> already exists")

Change-Id: Ie90cb49b8f11e3283fe509e95a8e9fd468cc9892

commit_message:
heat tests : bugfix utils cleanup function

end state for stacks is DELETE_COMPLETE, but then they
are deleted, hence we need to test for either DELETE_COMPLETE
or a null result to avoid false failures

Change-Id: I7e35c5a734d1005fa38d587353cbca5b911ec77b
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow for deleting VMs from  down compute nodes.

Fix bug 872899

If compute node service_is_up returns false, just delete the VM from
the database. If compute node recovers, setting
running_deleted_instance_action=reap will clean up the node.

Change-Id: Ibb5f1e22c2e482d304c59a485a04b882ead0c67d

[{'created': '2012-09-13 12:13:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes import issue on Windows

Fixes Bug #1034043

The crypt module is not available on Windows.
Since this is a blocking issue on Hyper-V and since the only
function using it is _set_passwd (not implemented on Windows),
the import can be safely conditionally avoided.

Change-Id: Iefe97edcfcff3b70593e07628b6a6f85e680cbc7
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes import issue on Windows

Fixes Bug #1034043

The crypt module is not available on Windows.
Since this is a blocking issue on Hyper-V and since the only
function using it is _set_passwd (not implemented on Windows),
the import can be safely conditionally avoided.

Change-Id: Iefe97edcfcff3b70593e07628b6a6f85e680cbc7

subject: add support for specifying I/O bandwidth limitation for rsync
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 124, 'name': 'Kazutaka Morita', 'email': 'morita.kazutaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'morita-kazutaka'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 2696, 'name': 'Darrell Bishop', 'email': 'dbishop@nvidia.com', 'username': 'darrellb'}, {'_account_id': 2828, 'name': 'Michael Barton', 'email': 'mike@weirdlooking.com', 'username': 'redbo'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-10 07:33:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-merge/486/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-docs/116/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-pep8/259/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python26/365/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python27/366/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-08-13 09:41:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-08-13 09:59:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

oops, meant to +2 that'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2012-08-13 17:53:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This puts a bandwidth limit per-connection on all replicators cluster-wide.

Is there a way to do this only on certain nodes? That would let operators turn down replication rates on newly-added nodes so as not to overwhelm them, but still let the rest of their cluster replicate at full speed.'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-08-13 18:35:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

Not that I know of.  I wish rsync supported bandwidth limiting on the daemon side.  I think we pull some shenanigans with max connections to keep new nodes from getting overwhelmed.

Actually, now that you mention it, I'll take away my +2, since you wouldn't want to hobble replication on the entire cluster because you have new nodes.  You could choose a different bwlimit for new nodes, but I don't know how you'd tell it which nodes are new without being operationally horrible.  Hmm..."}, {'account_id': 124, 'date': '2012-08-20 11:07:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

How about using different bandwidth limits for primary nodes and
hand-off ones?

If the target node is a primary one, rsync should limit the bandwidth
because the node is a newly added one or so overwhelmed that it failed
to handle PUT requests.

If the target node is a hand-off one, rsync should replicate the
object at full speed to recover its redundancy level ASAP.'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-08-20 19:26:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

There's an operational work-around for this (vs. a behavior change via configuration).  You can regulate replication traffic into a new node with its devices' weights in the ring.  You can adjust the rate at which you ratchet new devices' weights up from 0 to their eventual target weight.  That wouldn't affect replication efficiency of the rest of the cluster."}, {'account_id': 124, 'date': '2012-08-21 06:55:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the info.  It will help us a lot, but we'd like to have
more autonomous way to control traffic if possible.  Updating a ring
file and distributing it every min_part_hours is a bit pain."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-08-30 18:57:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

rsync bandwidth limiting is client-side, so it doesn't help nearly as much when you have a big cluster (eg many nodes syncing to you). Everyone agrees that hobbling the whole cluster for the sake of a new node is a bad idea; doing something more fine-grained than that inside Swift is a bad idea IMO because it's a fair bit of complexity that /could/ live outside Swift as operational infrastructure.

A better plan would be to use the rsync max connections option (in rsyncd.conf) and limit the concurrency of connections for the server. Swift needs docs and examples explaining this."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-14 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-14 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-10 07:31:37.000000000', 'message': 'add support for specifying I/O bandwidth limitation for rsync

When nodes are newly added to Swift, they can easily become overloaded
because of object replication.  This allows us more fine grained
control over it.

Change-Id: Id5f9ce160ce632eaaff76858d27f9a677eaa9700
'}]
commit_message:
add support for specifying I/O bandwidth limitation for rsync

When nodes are newly added to Swift, they can easily become overloaded
because of object replication.  This allows us more fine grained
control over it.

Change-Id: Id5f9ce160ce632eaaff76858d27f9a677eaa9700

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-14 05:29:19.000000000', 'message': 'Change the qpid_heartbeat default to 60 seconds.

The heartbeat option enables sending a message at the AMQP layer at a
regular interval.  This helps ensure that the connection is still up and
working.  Once a failure is detected, a reconnection can be attempted.

The default for qpid_heartbeat was previously 5 seconds.  This is pretty
aggressive and can lead to invalid timeouts occuring.  An example is the
nova-compute service.  It may block in native code (such as libvirt)
under normal circumstances.  When this happens, other greenthreads (such
as the one responsible for sending the heartbeat) can not be scheduled.
This patch makes the default a less aggressive 1 minute.

Fix bug 1050661.

Change-Id: Idce48944050c331dda85e9b10ab6f5b025845c34
(cherry picked from commit 1a9d5c8df5aeee4faf99b54800566e386166836d)
'}]
commit_message:
Change the qpid_heartbeat default to 60 seconds.

The heartbeat option enables sending a message at the AMQP layer at a
regular interval.  This helps ensure that the connection is still up and
working.  Once a failure is detected, a reconnection can be attempted.

The default for qpid_heartbeat was previously 5 seconds.  This is pretty
aggressive and can lead to invalid timeouts occuring.  An example is the
nova-compute service.  It may block in native code (such as libvirt)
under normal circumstances.  When this happens, other greenthreads (such
as the one responsible for sending the heartbeat) can not be scheduled.
This patch makes the default a less aggressive 1 minute.

Fix bug 1050661.

Change-Id: Idce48944050c331dda85e9b10ab6f5b025845c34
(cherry picked from commit 1a9d5c8df5aeee4faf99b54800566e386166836d)

commit_message:
Change the qpid_heartbeat default to 60 seconds.

The heartbeat option enables sending a message at the AMQP layer at a
regular interval.  This helps ensure that the connection is still up and
working.  Once a failure is detected, a reconnection can be attempted.

The default for qpid_heartbeat was previously 5 seconds.  This is pretty
aggressive and can lead to invalid timeouts occuring.  An example is the
nova-compute service.  It may block in native code (such as libvirt)
under normal circumstances.  When this happens, other greenthreads (such
as the one responsible for sending the heartbeat) can not be scheduled.
This patch makes the default a less aggressive 1 minute.

Fix bug 1050661.

Change-Id: Idce48944050c331dda85e9b10ab6f5b025845c34

commit_message:
Sync notifier changes from openstack-common

Syncs the following from stable/folsom:

 c767e9b Add multiple-driver support to the notifier api.

Also remove notification_driver from cinder.flags. This should
have been done when first adopting this code from openstack-common
since the option is defined there now.

Note: I've left the cinder-specific change to use cinder's context
rather than openstack-common's context.

Change-Id: I6ff4b5d45ca9cc4acaf37c62c143f2886ebee423

[{'created': '2012-09-13 16:54:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add a resume delete on volume manager startup

  Currently if for some reason the volume service was stopped
  during the zero out operation of a volume delete there was
  no way to get the volume removed from the system (it would
  be present in deleting status forever).

  This change adds a simple check of volumes in the DB with status
  of deleting, and if any are found it restarts the delete process
  on them.

  addresses bug #1011150

Change-Id: Id4c4a3bc61f95245ebc6658234b4b88029956562
'}]
commit_message:
Add a resume delete on volume manager startup

  Currently if for some reason the volume service was stopped
  during the zero out operation of a volume delete there was
  no way to get the volume removed from the system (it would
  be present in deleting status forever).

  This change adds a simple check of volumes in the DB with status
  of deleting, and if any are found it restarts the delete process
  on them.

  addresses bug #1011150

Change-Id: Id4c4a3bc61f95245ebc6658234b4b88029956562

commit_message:
Improve entity validation in volumes APIs

Fixes bug #1048565

Use the new Controller.is_valid_body() helper to validate the entity
body in various volumes related POST/PUT handlers and return 422
as appropriate.

Change-Id: I04127972981522c1ed81903893396c4f9665bcd3

commit_message:
Use tmpdir and avoid leaving test files behind

 We were just creating a file for testing iscsi persist files and
 weren't cleaning up after the test.

 Change this to use a tmpdir and make sure we leave no tracks.

 Fixes bug #1050086

Change-Id: I714177d7789da8b628ab63c163a2c3f1698dd940

commit_message:
Add more useful logging around the unmount fail case.

Raise a better message with a more useful message
rather than raising a process execution error, which
although useful is not especially meaningful.

Bug 1050645

Change-Id: Id9817de26fdb16f8fce17ebd093a9550e63be19c

[{'created': '2012-09-12 15:57:40.000000000', 'message': "added errno.EINVAL check to fallocate

On some systems (eg Illumos), posix_fallocate() returns
EINVAL when the underlying filesystem doesn't support the
operation. On Linux, the fallocate() call returns
EOPNOTSUPP.

The need for this patch was revealed by Victor Rodionov
<victor.rodionov@nexenta.com>.

Change-Id: If2104f92a44d41d0f91f4eb8aceb719095e4f98d
"}]
commit_message:
added errno.EINVAL check to fallocate

On some systems (eg Illumos), posix_fallocate() returns
EINVAL when the underlying filesystem doesn't support the
operation. On Linux, the fallocate() call returns
EOPNOTSUPP.

The need for this patch was revealed by Victor Rodionov
<victor.rodionov@nexenta.com>.

Change-Id: If2104f92a44d41d0f91f4eb8aceb719095e4f98d

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-13 20:00:33.000000000', 'message': 'tests: Clean up after a failed functional test

Ensure that whenever a stack is created, we delete it after the test by
putting the cleanup() call into the tearDown() method. For this to work,
we must also move the actual creation into the test itself, since an
exception during setUp() will mean that tearDown is not called.

Change-Id: I481e691f07c1af9e931258d7ba4453b2037c62ad
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
tests: Clean up after a failed functional test

Ensure that whenever a stack is created, we delete it after the test by
putting the cleanup() call into the tearDown() method. For this to work,
we must also move the actual creation into the test itself, since an
exception during setUp() will mean that tearDown is not called.

Change-Id: I481e691f07c1af9e931258d7ba4453b2037c62ad
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-07 16:51:09.000000000', 'message': 'Changes the qpid package that gets installed on Fedora

Changes the qpid package that will be installed on Fedora when
running stack.sh. The package name has changed recently (from
qpid-cpp-server to qpid-cpp-server-daemon) and if the old one
is installed, qpid service will fail to start.

Change-Id: Ia7cae795d7e456f0e21e0bedaee583a9e8b35f2d
'}, {'created': '2012-09-07 17:09:47.000000000', 'message': 'Changes the qpid package that gets installed on Fedora

Changes the qpid package that will be installed on Fedora when
running stack.sh. The original package (qpid-cpp-server) was
split up into qpid-cpp-server and qpid-cpp-server-daemon.
systemd unit files were moved into the second package and
if only the first package is installed, qpid service  fails
to start.

Change-Id: Ia7cae795d7e456f0e21e0bedaee583a9e8b35f2d
'}]
commit_message:
Changes the qpid package that gets installed on Fedora

Changes the qpid package that will be installed on Fedora when
running stack.sh. The original package (qpid-cpp-server) was
split up into qpid-cpp-server and qpid-cpp-server-daemon.
systemd unit files were moved into the second package and
if only the first package is installed, qpid service  fails
to start.

Change-Id: Ia7cae795d7e456f0e21e0bedaee583a9e8b35f2d
