commit_message:
Redefine the domain's XML on volume attach/detach

This fixes bug 1004791 by adding new disk definitions to the defined
XML instead of just modifying the running instance.

Cherry picked for stable/essex to fix bug 1012717.

Change-Id: I6596dae7c54158c32bc7b399c55a1797b2d98242

subject: Add 422 test unit test for servers API
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-12 12:14:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/12862/1/check/gate-nova-merge/8507 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12862/1/check/gate-nova-docs/4306 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12862/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/9618 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12862/1/check/gate-nova-python26/5769 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12862/1/check/gate-nova-python27/5828 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12862/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/11304 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12862/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/1285 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12862/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/730 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-09-13 00:46:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So I created this test suite about a month or so ago in this commit 00f0b170ec15299b20c345fa1f66f21185c2dc79. The initial point of the suite was in fact to test things explicitly with all the extensions enabled. Turns out we accidentally did that in some other places in the test suite and it uncovered some bugs... so it is certainly a good idea to keep doing it somewhere in my opinion.

From that commit message here are some notes about why we created ServersAllExtensionsTestCase:

As part of this fix I'm also moving test_create_missing_server out of the Scheduler Hints tests and into a new ServersAllExtensionsTestCase class in test_servers.py which explicitly tests for things with *all* extensions enabled. As part of the move I also updated the test to look for HTTP 422 Unprocessable Entity which is what we throw when 'server' doesn't exist in a POST to servers (the correct exception).

----

Feel free to add to the suite but I do think we need to leave all extensions enabled. At least that was the point initially."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-13 08:52:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'll put it this way - I'm adding more unit-test-like tests for 422 returns ... i.e. ServersUnprocessableEntityTestCase

I don't think it makes sense to leave the existing 422 testing in ServersAllExtensionsTestCase since it doesn't provide any more test coverage than ServersUnprocessableEntityTestCase

But if I remove them, then ServersAllExtensionsTestCase

I've no problem with the "we should run tests with all extensions enabled" concept, but it would make more sense to me if we had a sub-class of ServersControllerTest that ran the same tests but with all extensions enabled'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-09-13 12:12:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Returning a 422 from a request to create a server with all the extensions enabled is exactly what the previous test in ServersAllExtensionsTestCase was intended to cover. This covers a case where some of the extensions used to do this:

self._set_disk_config(body['server'])

Some of the extensions did this blindly without checking to make sure that the request body (created by the servers controller) actually did have a key for 'server'. This would be the case if the servers controller returned a 422.

Perhaps we do need to refactor this to make it more clear. That was in fact what we were trying to do by moving the old test case into ServersAllExtensionsTestCase."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-13 15:13:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-13 15:13:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks Dan, that explains it!'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-09-13 15:20:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Looks good. Thanks for taking the time to add a comment to help clarify this for anyone else who stumbles upon it.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-13 15:34:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-12 11:55:02.000000000', 'message': "Re-work 422 testing in servers API tests

ServersAllExtensionsTestCase is a strange beast - it says it's about
testing with all extensions enabled, but focuses just on when we throw
422. The tests also involve routing and de-serializing the request even
though unit testing this specific part of the code can be done while
involving much less of the stack.

Also, we have one other 422 test which is done the much simpler way.

Rename the test case to ServersUnprocessableEntityTestCase and fill it
with simple 422 tests.

Change-Id: Idb39e37f4a620199abb986793ae9415a5115dba9
"}, {'created': '2012-09-13 15:13:21.000000000', 'message': "Add 422 test unit test for servers API

Add a straightforward test case to check the cases where we're returning
422 from the servers API.

Add a comment to ServersAllExtensionsTestCase which clarifies who it
differs from these new 422 tests.

Change-Id: Idb39e37f4a620199abb986793ae9415a5115dba9
"}]
commit_message:
Add 422 test unit test for servers API

Add a straightforward test case to check the cases where we're returning
422 from the servers API.

Add a comment to ServersAllExtensionsTestCase which clarifies who it
differs from these new 422 tests.

Change-Id: Idb39e37f4a620199abb986793ae9415a5115dba9

prefix and keyname

commit_message:
Provide more default clients for smoke tests.

 * Refactored DefaultClientManager to support default clients
   for image, identity and network in addition to compute.  This
   change is intended to faciliate the creation of
   cross-functional smoke tests.
 * In support of bug 1043980

Change-Id: I45c0e6bf5fde41936df8838b7434c0b2074f4a02

commit_message:
Separate glance cache client from main client

This is relocating the necessary functionality for the glance
cache management tool into a new client class.

Related to bp separate-client

Change-Id: Ib89db1245aca5032a8d93876e07c562cb1fb5d4d

commit_message:
Add entity body validation helper

Add a _valid_body() helper for the to avoid repeating the same tests in
multiple methods. Include a check that the entity itself is actually a
dict.

(Cherry-picks part of commit d1ad73ee from Nova)

Change-Id: If8114cc76d68567005c85c803f29e30e034db89a

commit_message:
Should've added super().tearDown() in test_iscsi

  Made changes to use tempfiles and implemented teardown,
  but should have also called super().tearDown as well.

  Associated with chage: I9b9a2400

Change-Id: I2e9d1cb7bfbe78323630eb2f3270698a7ce7e4c4

commit_message:
Fix weird "None" displayed on some errors

logging.exception() should only be called from an exception handler,
which is not the case here.

Part of bug 1050260.

Change-Id: I591a68c458cd733c04cea7d2d640afdbb7dd19f6

commit_message:
heat had it's api split into two binaries (cfn & cloudwatch)

- Rename heat-api to heat-api-cfn
- Add heat-api-cloudwatch
- Also removed unused heat-engine-paste.ini file.
- Fix the path to the conf dir (etc/heat not etc/)

Change-Id: I9b2c7c5cd7052d5eb6d730833c65812c2f8a0ee1
Signed-off-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>

It looks reasonable.  I'd think it'd be better if generate_key_pair took a 'comment' argument and was then passed in with the tenant name or something.

The much saner path is 'nova keypair-add --pub-key ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub mykey'."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2012-09-13 12:48:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2012-09-13 12:09:18.000000000', 'message': 'Overload comment in generated SSH keys

Overload comment in generated SSH keys in order not to leak information
about the user and host that actually generated them. Patch based on a
suggestion by Pedro Perez.

Fixes bug 1050347.

Change-Id: I73bbdba1f6c9e83a5e7e70564959b9d7abaa5e29
'}]
commit_message:
Overload comment in generated SSH keys

Overload comment in generated SSH keys in order not to leak information
about the user and host that actually generated them. Patch based on a
suggestion by Pedro Perez.

Fixes bug 1050347.

Change-Id: I73bbdba1f6c9e83a5e7e70564959b9d7abaa5e29

[{'created': '2012-09-13 13:24:15.000000000', 'message': 'creating instances failed as a result of regression in last commit

The previous commit to the tree organizes resource names by
stack.resource.  Most of the openstack APIs take resource ids
but the instance create operation requires text identifiers.

Rewrite the text identifiers for the nova security groups before
starting an instance.

Change-Id: I8a842868781ecb353f66b5a4e3d022766a4c8a0e
Signed-off-by: Steven Dake <sdake@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
creating instances failed as a result of regression in last commit

The previous commit to the tree organizes resource names by
stack.resource.  Most of the openstack APIs take resource ids
but the instance create operation requires text identifiers.

Rewrite the text identifiers for the nova security groups before
starting an instance.

Change-Id: I8a842868781ecb353f66b5a4e3d022766a4c8a0e
Signed-off-by: Steven Dake <sdake@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-22 19:34:59.000000000', 'message': 'Raise NotImplementedError in dns_driver.DNSDriver.

Updates dns_driver.DNSDriver so that we raise NotImplementedError
instead of returning empty result sets or passing. Since this
class is the default dns_driver for Nova it can be quite
confusing when it returns empty results (which actually
causes some HTTP 500 errors as well).

Also updates several test suites to use MiniDNS instead
(which is meant for testing) including some additional
cleanup to remove the dnstest.txt file.

Fixes LP Bug #1040236.

Change-Id: I8aa1d20b8a12546eca1ced60bc7f283c8dac6332
'}]
commit_message:
Raise NotImplementedError in dns_driver.DNSDriver.

Updates dns_driver.DNSDriver so that we raise NotImplementedError
instead of returning empty result sets or passing. Since this
class is the default dns_driver for Nova it can be quite
confusing when it returns empty results (which actually
causes some HTTP 500 errors as well).

Also updates several test suites to use MiniDNS instead
(which is meant for testing) including some additional
cleanup to remove the dnstest.txt file.

Fixes LP Bug #1040236.

Change-Id: I8aa1d20b8a12546eca1ced60bc7f283c8dac6332

commit_message:
Return 400 if create volume snapshot force parameter is invalid

Fixes bug #1014689

* Add is_valid_boolstr function in utils.py
* Add force parameter check in SnapshotsController.create()
* Add unittest for invalid force parameter.

Change-Id: Ie6a07a2ac589da76f52a82b126a6d66e5987edc4

commit_message:
Backport changes from Cinder to Nova-Volume

NetApp C-mode driver.
Generic NFS-based block device driver.
NetApp NFS-based block device driver.

blueprint netapp-volume-driver-cmode
blueprint nfs-files-as-virtual-block-devices
blueprint netapp-nfs-cinder-driver
bug 1037619
bug 1037622

Change-Id: I513c3f88bcb03f3b71a453f92f5912d7730a8bbc

commit_message:
Add reservations parameter when cast "create_volume" to volume manager

Fixes bug #1050192

Add reservations parameter when _cast_create_volume cast
"create_volume" to volume manager. So VolumeManager.create_volume() can
commit the reservations in volume quota.

Change-Id: I8f3104d53bde55d4d83f39253869cc78a8511750

Just read that I should add myself to Authors file on first commit, going to do that tomorrow when I'm back at my work pc, if this patch is useful for others."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-09-03 16:26:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Minor typo in the commit message, also AFAIK the Authors file is now auto-generated so you don't need to worry about updating that.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-09-03 19:44:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

actually authors file isn't necessary any more. I am curious as to what you are planning on adding to HostAPI. Also the code for louding the compute api is incorrect, since it happens at import time.  This makes it hard to change the flag for config option, etc. The compute api loading code and the new hostapi loading code (and network api loading code for that matter) should follow the method that the volume api loading code uses here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/volume/__init__.py#L19"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-09-03 19:44:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 5319, 'date': '2012-09-04 02:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5319, 'date': '2012-09-04 02:37:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks both of you for looking at the code! It's my first time commiting to an opensource project. 

Adding a test may be possible, so want to see if there's a meanginful method to unit test the importing. Suggestions are welcome.

@Vish: In the small startup I work for we sometimes do quick patches, often those are small niche changes. For example we changed the host_power_action to also check if the host is up and add the compute_node_id of the host as parameter. If the host is not up we show a message in Horizon that the Host is already shutdown or malfunctioning. (The quality isn't always good enough yet though, but we're trying to improve everything. Company started recently with changing openstack and I just joined here. So lots of re-orginazing.)

But I think it's also nice to have an option to extend anything in Openstack that makes it easy to seperate niche changes from core functionality. Before we dirty changed the core functionality and we lost the overview of what we changed making it hard to upgrade to a new version.

About why I had to change so many tests see this error message: http://pastebin.com/hHdXsJWV"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-04 02:43:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Wow, sorry, i didn't realize that change was going to require so many test fixes, but nice work!"}, {'account_id': 5319, 'date': '2012-09-05 05:04:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hehe thanks! Hope I can do some more :) What about that bug in nova/api/ec2/cloud.py felt really weird that I stumbled upon a bug, because I couldn't figure out what caused it. The change I made shouldn't have influenced that.

So was the bug in cloud.py already there?

Another issue, Patch Set 5 is exactly the same as Patch Set 6, but the automatic verifier didn't pass it in Set 5. Maybe a bug there? I already had this feeling that it was not my fault so I only changed the commit message to let Jenkings and Smokestack run the tests again."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-09-05 14:36:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

the import was probably getting pulled in before through a dependency somehow. Occasionally the gates fail, you can check again by issuing a comment with just the word 'recheck' instead of changing the commit message."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-09-05 20:32:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-06 01:23:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-09-07 18:29:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-09-10 16:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

What is the use case for this?'}, {'account_id': 5319, 'date': '2012-09-11 06:06:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

To add custom functionality or override functions of the HostAPI for niche changes, which won't be accepted in upstream or if the company doesn't allow to push to upstream .

An example use case for the company I work for, we implemented  a function get_host_log, which basically returns DMESG of the host. There may be some niche functionality only some people will use for hosts, and for those people it should be easy to extend the HostAPI, as its possible like any API in Openstack.

We also changed the host_power_action to check if the host is up and get the compute_node_id and changed the rpc_call to rpc_cast, but those changes will probably not make it into upstream."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-09-11 12:29:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This really doesn't seem like something we should allow completely overriding.  This is an internal implementation detail and not something intended to be re-implemented.  If we have an option to override it, we're locking ourselves down to this implementation detail, which I think is a bad idea.  Adding another custom method seems easy enough to do with a patch to a custom version of nova."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-11 12:37:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Do not merge

I agree with Russell on this - why not just patch the code?

I don't think Nova should be infinitely plugable"}, {'account_id': 5319, 'date': '2012-09-11 14:51:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Agree with Russel also, but then it may be better to remove the whole HostAPI, and move the functions of HostAPI to the nova.compute.API, so we can at least override functions. Why is there a seperate HostAPI, API, AggregateAPI, but only for API it's extensible and the others not? 

But I think it's better to not merge also now looking at the arguments of Russel, that we would be forcing this implementation detail by having the flag which defaults to HostAPI.

Thanks for the good reviews!"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-09-11 16:50:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Honestly, I wasn't aware of the compute_api_class, network_api_class, and volume_api_class options.  I don't like any of them and hope that we can remove them ASAP and find alternatives to whatever prompted them to be added in the first place."}, {'account_id': 5319, 'date': '2012-09-12 02:13:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

They are definitely usefull for us, we did some changes to a custom VNC client they made inhouse using SPICE or something, I'm not sure what they changed exactly but I'm happy we could seperate our changes from the upstream code so we can later still evuluate if its useful and/or can be submitted to upstream. So for those kind of niche changes it should be easy to add in an extendable way.

If we just directly change the original code merging with upstream will get harder.

I thought that's why the nova_api_class flags etc are there also, to make extending or adding some functionality to some existing functionanility and they work well for that. You can nearly extend anything. See the following flags, we are currently using for extending:
osapi_compute_extension=nova.custom_extensions.api.openstack.compute.contrib.custom_extensions
compute_manager=nova.custom_extensions.compute.manager.ComputeManager
compute_api_class=nova.custom_extensions.compute.api.API
compute_hostapi_class=nova.custom_extensions.compute.api.HostAPI
compute_driver=nova.custom_extensions.virt.connection.get_connection
connection_type=custom_extensions-libvirt
libvirt_xml_template=$pybasedir/nova/virt/libvirt.xml.template.extended

This makes it easy to see hey our patches contained a bug, instead of thinking was this Openstack's bug or introduced by us?

Hope I helped a little bit instead of taking valuable time. Will try to learn more and start working on small bugs or documentation first."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-12 05:17:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I don't see these options as a viable solution for people maintaining downstream patches

Seriously, git (or diff and patch) is what you want to use for downstream patches"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-09-12 05:55:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

the network and volume ones are specifically to support cinder and quantum without breaking the existing code. Compute has not been needed so far (unless the cells code uses it), but it definitely should not be happening at import time regardless.'}, {'account_id': 5319, 'date': '2012-09-12 06:44:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

We use both git diff and patch, but it got really painfull having to upgrade to a new release when we don't seperate our changes. 
Many files got removed, renamed and totally restructered in folsom, so we woud loose track of our downstream patches and had to manually merge a lot of files.

I probably just don't know how to properly manage it, but found it quite a nice solution that we were using now, extending and overriding or adding functionality in our extended API which derives from the upstream compute API. So the basic functionality stays the same. But seems it's not meant for that and just going through the painful merge is the suggested way?

We could also note down any changes with the patch and after a new release check which one needs to be re-applied and re-apply them manually if they dont apply automatically using git. Was that what you meant? Would become hard to manage as the downstream patches get more and more, which is the current situation here."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-12 07:30:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Try using git rebase - it'll handle file moves and the like

The way you're doing it now is limited - there's only so much you can do by sub-classes these APIs - and you'll need to do manual work on each update anyway because we will constantly make changes that breaks your sub-classing"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-09-12 15:24:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Regarding the other options for cinder and quantum ... I think I'd rather see options that look like "enable_quantum" or "enable_cinder" and do the right things internally, instead of exposing swapping out internal classes via a configuration option.

I filed a bug to track looking at changing these: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1049249'}, {'account_id': 5319, 'date': '2012-09-13 09:11:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Rebased'}, {'account_id': 5319, 'date': '2012-09-13 09:13:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Abandoned

No need for this patch as the flags will be removed. It was just me using a wrong way to do downstream patches.

Thanks for good advice of using git rebase it works really well.'}]

commit_message:
Adds support for extending compute.api.HostAPI

Added flag: 'compute_hostapi_class', which lets you
specify a custom HostAPI class. Uses the same method
as loading the volume.API.
Also updated the compute_api_class to be loaded
the same way as the volume.API. As this makes
it possible to change the flags in runtime.

A lot of tests were failing because if we use a function,
we can not directly Stub attributes of the api as a function
doesn't have those.

Also fixed a bug in nova/api/ec2/cloud.py
which was accessing compute.api.SecurityGroupAPI
but was missing the import for nova.compute.api.
Causing some tests to fail.

Added way to test if extending of compute_api and
compute_hostapi is working.

Change-Id: Icafb57cea1dcef92d70f8210f038aef406556f91

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-13 05:45:11.000000000', 'message': 'creating instances failed as a result of regression in last commit

The previous commit to the tree organizes resource names by
stack.resource.  Most of the openstack APIs take resource ids
but the instance create operation requires text identifiers.

Rewrite the text identifiers for the nova security groups before
starting an instance.

Change-Id: I98006396244f8b318f3107ca96472084545a7f3c
Signed-off-by: Steven Dake <sdake@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
creating instances failed as a result of regression in last commit

The previous commit to the tree organizes resource names by
stack.resource.  Most of the openstack APIs take resource ids
but the instance create operation requires text identifiers.

Rewrite the text identifiers for the nova security groups before
starting an instance.

Change-Id: I98006396244f8b318f3107ca96472084545a7f3c
Signed-off-by: Steven Dake <sdake@redhat.com>

As commit 4082c8375a6ae7e7e67c7ad2e263be2d5fc3dd1f says,
one ordinary task is running, so that task_state is set. The
live_migrate task is accepted at API, and will change task_state to
MIGRATING. However the first task may continue to update task_state or
set it to None as it finishes.

This patch avoids it by updating task_state in compute.api.live_migrate
level with expected_task_state=None.

Fixes bug 1049533

commit_message:
Avoid live migrate overwriting the other task_state

As commit 4082c8375a6ae7e7e67c7ad2e263be2d5fc3dd1f says,
one ordinary task is running, so that task_state is set. The
live_migrate task is accepted at API, and will change task_state to
MIGRATING. However the first task may continue to update task_state or
set it to None as it finishes.

This patch avoids it by updating task_state in compute.api.live_migrate
level with expected_task_state=None.

Add test case for compute.api.live_migrate.

Fixes bug 1049533

Change-Id: Ida8cef4797de421a7e356c9f5e882fe926535639

The templated backend for Keystone is limited and does not support the
CRUD operations so does not fully exercise the Identity API.  Change
the default to SQL but leave the templated back-end in place for now.

commit_message:
Change default keystone backend to sql

The templated backend for Keystone is limited and does not support the
CRUD operations so does not fully exercise the Identity API.  Change
the default to SQL but leave the templated back-end in place for now.

Set KEYSTONE_CATALOG_BACKEND=template in localrc to restore the old
behaviour.

Change-Id: Id4490194d49b8004583016a9666cb9439cd4700a

commit_message:
Adds more servers list and servers details samples

This moves the servers detail test into the base servers test so
it runs with all_extensions as well. It also renames the
results to be consistent with the other tests. Finally it
adds test for servers-list both with and without extensions.

Change-Id: I6eed3932fa594f1a39faa55453461680781e6a9f

subject: fix rpcapi version.
messages:
[{'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-09-11 17:31:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is there documentation somewhere on when and how to update the various versions?'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-09-11 17:33:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The only docs are here:  https://github.com/openstack/openstack-common/blob/master/openstack/common/rpc/dispatcher.py#L18

I'm sure there is room for improvement.  I also wish there was a better place to put the docs."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-09-11 17:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Russell, How about in the nova devref?'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-09-11 17:38:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

An option might be to just add a NOTE above BASE_RPC_API_VERSION with a reference to nova/openstack/common/rpc/dispatcher.py

I think we'll continue seeing updates like this since we add documentation on the new version right above BASE_RPC_API_VERSION but only sometimes update the value. Adding a quick note might go a long way to making it clearer."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-09-11 17:47:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-09-11 17:48:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Joe, nova devref isn't really ideal either because this rpc stuff is in openstack-common.  It's not nova-specific."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-09-11 17:50:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Russell, is there any devref equivalent in openstack-common, that can be pulled into each repo when openstack-common is pulled in?  Also putting something in nova's devref is still better then nothing."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-09-11 17:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Thanks for the extra comments'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-11 18:25:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
fix rpcapi version.

In commit ce4dbbd7, the BASE_RPC_API_VERSION was changed to '2.1' in
nova.compute.rpcapi.  This should remain '2.0' until the API goes to
3.X.  Only specify version '2.1' for the method that requires it
(rebuild_instance).

Add a NOTE above each instance of BASE_RPC_API_VERSION to try to help
clarify this for the future.

Change-Id: I06cef44c905e8966505d5fb5b1046d6a0c75d533

[{'created': '2012-09-11 00:39:51.000000000', 'message': "Add flag cinder_endpoint_template to volume.cinder

Add optional flag to allow cinder endpoint to be defined by flag rather
than extracted from the request context's service catalog.  No change to
default behavior.

This flag allows deployers to use a seperate management endpoint for
cinder which compute can use exclusively to send messages to cinder, or
just use an auth system that doesn't add/forward the catalog along with
the request (e.g. noauth).

fix lp bug #1048798

Change-Id: Icb416bf4df2a6e37024f1fbc866006d46d30bcf2
"}, {'created': '2012-09-11 00:52:29.000000000', 'message': "Add flag cinder_endpoint_template to volume.cinder

Add optional flag to allow cinder endpoint to be defined by flag rather
than extracted from the request context's service catalog.  No change to
default behavior.

This flag allows deployers to use a seperate management endpoint for
cinder which compute can use exclusively to send messages to cinder, or
just use an auth system that doesn't add/forward the catalog along with
the request (e.g. noauth).

Add python-cinderclient to tools/test-requires

fix lp bug #1048798

Change-Id: Icb416bf4df2a6e37024f1fbc866006d46d30bcf2
"}]
commit_message:
Add flag cinder_endpoint_template to volume.cinder

Add optional flag to allow cinder endpoint to be defined by flag rather
than extracted from the request context's service catalog.  No change to
default behavior.

This flag allows deployers to use a seperate management endpoint for
cinder which compute can use exclusively to send messages to cinder, or
just use an auth system that doesn't add/forward the catalog along with
the request (e.g. noauth).

Add python-cinderclient to tools/test-requires

fix lp bug #1048798

Change-Id: Icb416bf4df2a6e37024f1fbc866006d46d30bcf2

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-10 23:06:20.000000000', 'message': 'More specific lxml versions in tools/pip-requires

Changed lxml version in tools/pip-requires from >=2.3,<3 to
>=2.3,<2.3.5.  pip was apparently accepting 3.0alpha as a <3 requirement
but the ordering of elements changes in that version.  Some of the
libvirt tests would pass with lxml 3.0alpha but fail with any 2.3.x
version.  The tests now pass with any version of lxml within the range
specified.

Change-Id: I2d84d32f1bf6fba2c6dbe05799a284a44d4c39d8
'}]
commit_message:
More specific lxml versions in tools/pip-requires

Changed lxml version in tools/pip-requires from >=2.3,<3 to
>=2.3,<2.3.5.  pip was apparently accepting 3.0alpha as a <3 requirement
but the ordering of elements changes in that version.  Some of the
libvirt tests would pass with lxml 3.0alpha but fail with any 2.3.x
version.  The tests now pass with any version of lxml within the range
specified.

Change-Id: I2d84d32f1bf6fba2c6dbe05799a284a44d4c39d8

commit_message:
Make ConnectionRefused error more informative.

When the server refuses the connection the error message displayed now
lists the endpoint that refused the connection.

Fixes: bug 1043067
Change-Id: I62797106732bbb6eec8c99e491fd38850ad58ff8

commit_message:
Update SolidFire volume driver

Implements blueprint update-solidfire-driver

* Updates driver to reflect changes in the release version of SF API
* Modify SF naming scheme
* Implement snapshot functionality
* Implement setting qos on create via metadata
* Update/Add tests

(cherry picked from cinder commit df5c4ba)

Change-Id: I08f7aac31e9d95f971d297a19c285dfa7151b931

commit_message:
Use tmpdir and avoid leaving test files behind

 We were just creating a file for testing iscsi persist files and
 weren't cleaning up after the test.

 Change this to use a tmpdir and make sure we leave no tracks.

 Fixes bug #1050086

Change-Id: I9b9a2400a172d52987d76f3132793cb042fd201c

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-12 17:42:06.000000000', 'message': "Update rpc from openstack-common.

Fix bug 1049843.

This commit syncs the following commit from openstack-common:

    commit 7e9f72bb28456c912aa80945dbdb8d200f81b462
    Make projects define 'control_exchange'.

This change allows cinder to set a project-specific default of 'cinder'
for the 'control_exchange' option.  The option is now defined in
cinder.flags.

Change-Id: Ia91c172ca0665798d616f9faf5880770074235c8
"}]
commit_message:
Update rpc from openstack-common.

Fix bug 1049843.

This commit syncs the following commit from openstack-common:

    commit 7e9f72bb28456c912aa80945dbdb8d200f81b462
    Make projects define 'control_exchange'.

This change allows cinder to set a project-specific default of 'cinder'
for the 'control_exchange' option.  The option is now defined in
cinder.flags.

Change-Id: Ia91c172ca0665798d616f9faf5880770074235c8

commit_message:
Stop fetch_ca from throwing IOError exceptions

Fixes bug #883300

Fixes problem where fetch_ca could throw an IOError exception rather
than a Nova specific exception.
Adds FileError exception.
Fixes other functions in crypto.py that had very similar problems.

Change-Id: Ic2e43c35ad58c67d33156c53d2a41910dfdf8678

commit_message:
Implement volume quota support in the cinderclient

  * fix for bug 1023311
  * Implements quota extensions in cinderclient
  * Implements absolute limits and rate limits

Change-Id: I7e3f8474476cbc03efb2fefcb8400f5fec85ddcb

commit_message:
Add volume quota in volume/api.py and olume/manager.py

Fixes bug #1048158

volume.api.API.create() call QUOTAS.reserve(), then
volume.manager.VolumeManager.create_volume call QUOTAS.commit().
volume.manager.VolumeManager.delete_volume call QUOTAS.reserve() and
QUOTAS.commit().

It also fixes bug #1049459.

Change-Id: I764aeec83cce93595fbe9aa00205a7d8c9e13c35

commit_message:
Rewrite Swift store functional tests

The existing functional tests for the Swift store depend on
spinning up a full system. We really just want to test that
our store interface is good, so this patch adds tests for
just that.

Prevent swift store from prepending 'http[s]://' to auth url
if it is already there. This should be broken into a different patch.

Running the tests works the same way, just define a local config
with the necessary swift_* options. Set the GLANCE_TEST_SWIFT_CONF
environment variable to the location of that config.

The old full-stack tests have been removed.

Change-Id: I506993ce44354950534443c2101f8417a2a918e0

commit_message:
Update v2.0 API version to CURRENT

The v2.0 API is stable, so we need to communicate this fact to the
consumers of Glance. This updates the status of the v2.0 version
entity in responses from / and those that result in a 300 Multiple
Choices status code from 'EXPERIMENTAL' to 'CURRENT.'

Change-Id: I9e4514025904d7be2e947c6d14ccb90b6b066f8c

By default, enabled does not exist on that object, and changing our code is just accepting that.  A longer term, and better approach, is to use the config file for all of the LDAP bindins, to include which fields to ignore.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-11 01:49:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

2012-09-11 08:34:45    ERROR [root] {'info': 'tenantId: attribute type undefined', 'desc': 'Undefined attribute type'}

The CLI command I ran to generate this error was:
sudo keystone --token MYTESTADMINTOKEN --endpoint=http://localhost:35357/v2.0 user-create --name=admin --pass=password --email=admin@example.com --tenant_id=fd0ff2ac28de4babb1ad72a3b484d720

In order to get past this error I had to add 'tenantId' to the attribute_ignore list in the UserApi class as indicated in the bug. Once I did this I was able to create a new user with LDAP backend.

I marking this review as +1 because the code I see looks fine, but in reality it does not fix the whole issue as I noted above."}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-09-11 18:22:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-11 01:28:07.000000000', 'message': "LDAP backend attribute fixes

R Boden and Adam Young assissted on this patch.

There are two issues with the TenantAPI for the ldap Identity.

There is a mistaken attribute_mapping entry, which was mapping
'description' into 'desc'. Per RFC 2256 there should be no need to map
this as the attribute as it is already 'description' in the LDAP
schema. I am not aware of any other schema that would use 'desc'
attribute for a 'groupOfNames' object.

Since there is no support (yet) for users, tenants or roles to be
enabled/disabled there needs to be a attribute_ignore set for the
'enabled' attribute.

Bug 980085

Change-Id: I40afa7a1345c45c119e699bf4fd4c99652f66c2f
"}, {'created': '2012-09-11 20:13:35.000000000', 'message': "LDAP backend attribute fixes

R Boden and Adam Young assissted on this patch.

There are two issues with the TenantAPI for the ldap Identity.

There is a mistaken attribute_mapping entry, which was mapping
'description' into 'desc'. Per RFC 2256 there should be no need to map
this as the attribute as it is already 'description' in the LDAP
schema. I am not aware of any other schema that would use 'desc'
attribute for a 'groupOfNames' object.

Since there is no support (yet) for users, tenants or roles to be
enabled/disabled there needs to be a attribute_ignore set for the
'enabled' attribute.

Bug 980085

Change-Id: I40afa7a1345c45c119e699bf4fd4c99652f66c2f
"}]
commit_message:
LDAP backend attribute fixes

R Boden and Adam Young assissted on this patch.

There are two issues with the TenantAPI for the ldap Identity.

There is a mistaken attribute_mapping entry, which was mapping
'description' into 'desc'. Per RFC 2256 there should be no need to map
this as the attribute as it is already 'description' in the LDAP
schema. I am not aware of any other schema that would use 'desc'
attribute for a 'groupOfNames' object.

Since there is no support (yet) for users, tenants or roles to be
enabled/disabled there needs to be a attribute_ignore set for the
'enabled' attribute.

Bug 980085

Change-Id: I40afa7a1345c45c119e699bf4fd4c99652f66c2f

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-10 19:18:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix flavor deletion when there is a deleted flavor

If there is a deleted flavor with the same ID as an undeleted flavor,
the flavormanage delete code attempts to delete it again, which fails.
This patch makes sure to pass read_deleted='no' when the flavor is
retrieved for deletion so we get the undeleted flavor. Includes a
failing test to make sure the value is passed properly.

Fixes bug 1048678

Change-Id: If6a20de2526b7ba90ada4a40317a98f79b2141dc
"}]
commit_message:
Fix flavor deletion when there is a deleted flavor

If there is a deleted flavor with the same ID as an undeleted flavor,
the flavormanage delete code attempts to delete it again, which fails.
This patch makes sure to pass read_deleted='no' when the flavor is
retrieved for deletion so we get the undeleted flavor. Includes a
failing test to make sure the value is passed properly.

Fixes bug 1048678

Change-Id: If6a20de2526b7ba90ada4a40317a98f79b2141dc

In this case, I don't really care what you call those methods as long as the methods don't imply that the resource is free and available after the method is called which free_volume implies. commit_message:
Add 'detaching' to volume status

Fixes bug #1004382

When attach a volume , the volume status is "available -> attaching ->
in-use", But when detaching a volume , the volume status is "in-use ->
available". So We need 'detaching' volume status, it make the change of
state of the volume more clearly.

Change-Id: I544220c206899307294d50e26679f5351fdc0cd7

commit_message:
Rename _unplug_vifs to unplug_vifs

self._vmops is of type VMWareVMOps, which doesn't have unplug_vifs
defined.

Partially fix bug 1037183

Change-Id: I561788fbfea1d221e13850e93593f8b9a96d9f7c

commit_message:
Check flavor id on resize.

Actually it checks for memory size changes so you can't change just cpu or hdd when resizing instances.

Fixes bug 1049195

Change-Id: I793d19dbf5f1d89d365e63ab61b4edb983fdb11c

for details was broken. This fixes the test and makes sure that

commit_message:
Makes key_name show in details view of servers

The wrong authorizor was being used in the details view and the test
for details was broken. This fixes the test and makes sure that
key_name shows up in details like it is supposed to.

Fixes bug 1043584

Change-Id: I4ff01bbd32759f30e7a31ef2eac9f58922843037

commit_message:
Change Stack to support user defined parameter

This change allows tests to specify DBUsername/DBPassword if necessary.
The keyname is still looked up in nova and the distribution is retrieved
from the already existing Stack parameter.

Change-Id: I3732ffb685d68c8a72a83247f74ed11a50a74cd1
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add createBackup, os-migrateLive, and os-resetState api

fixes bug 1042652

createBackup, os-migrateLive, and os-resetState is a part of
Compute API extension: admin-actions.
Add their documents to api.openstack.org.

Change-Id: I6f7636a9987f7a37d3479a0446d80639bd4911b0

commit_message:
Adds a small section regarding the enabling of ip forwarding.

Patch does minor formatting changes to ensure the <computeroutput>
looks okay.

Also the Compute Admin manual's build doesn't have the smarts
to output conditional with the os="ubuntu" attributes, so rewrote
to indicate both examples are for different distros.

Change-Id: Ia7decb6cb3eae8cdf0f206dd4b35b491e9ef26e7

[{'created': '2012-09-11 05:49:19.000000000', 'message': 'Makes handling of nic args more robust

Legacy users of novaclient may not pass all of the new nic args,
so this patch only passes them on if they are set.

Fixes bug 1044231

Change-Id: I1c8323a3a09613ad4e8dfcc1dfe379dbda50f125
'}]
commit_message:
Makes handling of nic args more robust

Legacy users of novaclient may not pass all of the new nic args,
so this patch only passes them on if they are set.

Fixes bug 1044231

Change-Id: I1c8323a3a09613ad4e8dfcc1dfe379dbda50f125

commit_message:
Support flavor extra specs in nova client

Add flavor extra specs so that user can list/set/unset
extra specs in nova client

blueprint extra-specs-in-nova-client

Change-Id: I6ad7293e29764648c79943c4d05f3a09931af411
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-12 16:32:54.000000000', 'message': "Avoid VM task state revert on instance termination

Related to bug 1046236.

Previously, if an exception is raised during the nova-compute node's
instance termination logic *before* the instance is evicted from the DB
(e.g. in the network teardown), then the task_state is reverted back to
None by the reverts_task_state decorator, so the instance continues
to be reported as ACTIVE with no outstanding task.

A subsequent attempt to delete the same instance results in the
quota_usages in_use count being decremented a second time.

This occurs despite I91a70ada as that fix depends on the VM task state
continuing to be DELETING. That logic was undermined in Id4358c50 which
caused the task state to be reverted on the successful or unsuccessful
conclusion of the action on the compute node.

Now, the motivation for Id4358c50 was to avoid the VM getting stuck with
a task state that prevents any further action other than deletion.
However in the case of a deletion already having been requested, this
protection is unnecessary and counter-productive. Hence we remove the
task state reversion from the terminate_instance action.

Change-Id: Ie5701e5c12f6241a203423d29d05df1858406c56

commit_message:
Avoid VM task state revert on instance termination

Related to bug 1046236.

Previously, if an exception is raised during the nova-compute node's
instance termination logic *before* the instance is evicted from the DB
(e.g. in the network teardown), then the task_state is reverted back to
None by the reverts_task_state decorator, so the instance continues
to be reported as ACTIVE with no outstanding task.

A subsequent attempt to delete the same instance results in the
quota_usages in_use count being decremented a second time.

This occurs despite I91a70ada as that fix depends on the VM task state
continuing to be DELETING. That logic was undermined in Id4358c50 which
caused the task state to be reverted on the successful or unsuccessful
conclusion of the action on the compute node.

Now, the motivation for Id4358c50 was to avoid the VM getting stuck with
a task state that prevents any further action other than deletion.
However in the case of a deletion already having been requested, this
protection is unnecessary and counter-productive. Hence we remove the
task state reversion from the terminate_instance action.

Change-Id: Ie5701e5c12f6241a203423d29d05df1858406c56

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-11 17:38:05.000000000', 'message': 'add tenant_id and make projectid optional

Add a new optional tenant_id keyword argument to the client classes
cinderclient.client.HTTPClient and cinderclient.v1.client.Client to
support authentication with tenant_id instead of projectid (which is
acctually used as "tenantName" in the auth request body).

Keystone can provide tokens without specifiying the tenant in any form,
but a tenantName _or_ tenantId is required to generate the catalog (the
keystone service code seems to prefer tenantName if both are specified).

When using cinderclient programatically, it may be more convienent,
depending on the context to authenticate with out specificying the
tenant, or by tenant_id instead of tenant_name.  Either way it's
impractial to make the requirement in the client for projectid
(tenantName) if the auth system has no such limitation.

The new client signature is backwards compatible.  There is no change in
behavior for the shell client.

Change-Id: I0c1bdbdabd9acc29133a48a798750323011f1f18
'}]
commit_message:
add tenant_id and make projectid optional

Add a new optional tenant_id keyword argument to the client classes
cinderclient.client.HTTPClient and cinderclient.v1.client.Client to
support authentication with tenant_id instead of projectid (which is
acctually used as "tenantName" in the auth request body).

Keystone can provide tokens without specifiying the tenant in any form,
but a tenantName _or_ tenantId is required to generate the catalog (the
keystone service code seems to prefer tenantName if both are specified).

When using cinderclient programatically, it may be more convienent,
depending on the context to authenticate with out specificying the
tenant, or by tenant_id instead of tenant_name.  Either way it's
impractial to make the requirement in the client for projectid
(tenantName) if the auth system has no such limitation.

The new client signature is backwards compatible.  There is no change in
behavior for the shell client.

Change-Id: I0c1bdbdabd9acc29133a48a798750323011f1f18

The v2.0 API is stable, so we need to communicate this fact to the
consumers of Glance. This updates the status of the v2.0 version
entity in responses from / and those that result in a 300 Multiple
Choices status code from 'EXPERIMENTAL' to 'CURRENT.'

Change-Id: I9e4514025904d7be2e947c6d14ccb90b6b066f8c
"}]
commit_message:
Update v2.0 API version to CURRENT

The v2.0 API is stable, so we need to communicate this fact to the
consumers of Glance. This updates the status of the v2.0 version
entity in responses from / and those that result in a 300 Multiple
Choices status code from 'EXPERIMENTAL' to 'CURRENT.'

Change-Id: I9e4514025904d7be2e947c6d14ccb90b6b066f8c

'}, {'created': '2012-09-10 14:38:31.000000000', 'message': "prepare_guest_template.sh fails when there are multiple xs-tools iso's in ISO_DIR

In the case of two iso's ('xs-tools-6.0.2.iso' and 'xs-tools-6.0.2-1111.iso'), TOOLS_ISO gets set to 'xs-tools-6.0.2-1111.iso xs-tools-6.0.2.iso' This causes 'mount -o loop xs-tools-6.0.2-1111.iso xs-tools-6.0.2.iso $TMP_DIR' to get called, which fails as it's meant to be called with only one file. This fix simply sets TOOLS_ISO to the first iso that ls returns.

commit_message:
prepare_guest_template.sh fails when there are multiple xs-tools iso's in ISO_DIR

In the case of two iso's ('xs-tools-6.0.2.iso' and 'xs-tools-6.0.2-1111.iso'),
TOOLS_ISO gets set to 'xs-tools-6.0.2-1111.iso xs-tools-6.0.2.iso' This causes
'mount -o loop xs-tools-6.0.2-1111.iso xs-tools-6.0.2.iso $TMP_DIR' to get
called, which fails as it's meant to be called with only one file. This fix
simply sets TOOLS_ISO to the first iso that ls returns.

Change-Id: Id4d883e2b1e33b233c9ee907016b4ce117c28021

[{'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-09-06 22:33:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

Nachi, 

first of all thanks for contributing to the API document.

Reviewing this patch, I've realized that netconn-api and the wiki page with the API spec are out of synch. Indeed most of your changes are related to stuff which was already updated there.

It would be great if could check that your changes are consistent with the wiki. After that we'll merge this patch."}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-09-07 00:12:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Salvatore

XML is supported now?
If so I will update XML side.
If not, I wanna remove xml spec.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-09-07 00:20:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

XML will not be supported in Quantum.
There's already another patch from Anne that partly deals with this.

The XML samples which should still be in the doc repository will not be built anyway as they're not included in the main doc file. However, feel free to remove them, we'll need to them from scratch anyway once we'll support XML, so there's no point in keeping them."}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-09-07 00:56:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Salvatore

If xml is not supported now, we should remove it.

I wanna do it after Anne's patch"}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-09-07 02:33:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

- removed permission attribute
- added device_owner attribute
- Fix response code
- Removed unused error code

commit_message:
Fixes bug 1049446.

Removed the "vtype" option which did not work in the driver, and
added the "easytier" option. Added another check to _check_flags
and made sure -warning flag is passed properly. Added unit tests
to check all option variations.

Change-Id: I4e66436f8f62d851a079ec80209fe9d6b27fb5b4

commit_message:
Make sure tgt is using config.d approach

Fixes bug 1045358.

On ubuntu Oneiric, the tgt configuration was not using the config.d
approach. tgt was unable to find the config files, so no volumes could
be created. This fix makes sure, that the config.d directory is there,
and the configuration includes files from there.

Was Cinder only, added same fix for Nova volumes

Change-Id: I6752cb628dd22e91e640f0f584fafefa4cd6d0f1

commit_message:
Delete user tokens after role grant/revoke

Delete user tokens when a new role is granted or revoked, in order to
prevent old tokens to continue to be valid for the original set of
roles for the remainder of the token's lifespan.

Addresses CVE-2012-4413.
Fixes bug 1041396.

Change-Id: Ib11b5b3a933c6000afe0c875c3f71f1f101bb202

commit_message:
Add is_package_installed function to know if a package is installed

This helps reduce the distro-dependent code in stack.sh, and also fixes
the bug where "rpm -qa | grep sudo" will work if gnome-sudoku is
installed.

Rebased

Change-Id: Ib1330b29b915b41d9724197edd791f0d4e0fe373

commit_message:
PowerVM: Establish SSH connection at use time

Establish SSH connection at use time in PowerVM compute driver, in order
to work around a paramiko error on slow networks. Patch based on a
proposal by David Peraza.

Fixes bug 1040785.

Change-Id: I1a656981fae2f384c748c077d608018a0aafb681

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix live block migration

Current check_can_live_migrate_destination trys to get instance info
by call self._conn.lookupByName(instance_name) on the destination
host before migrating. Because the instance is not on the destination
host yet, it failes with InstanceNotFound.

This fix gets the available disk size of the destination side.
On the source side, checks whether the above space is enough before
migrating.

Fixes bug 1044237

Change-Id: I20f64e1f85828049b697a4b1173bac8e5779d45a

bug 1049897

commit_message:
Reset task state before rescheduling

Reset the task state to SCHEDULING before attempting re-scheduling.
This is a precaution to make sure subsequent calls to update the
task state see an 'expected_task_state'.

bug 1049897

Change-Id: I5667a88487bd7039eb2e0aaebef532199d8b31ef

If you buy this would right now be a good time to make this change? (before you have to sync other projects, etc)"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-09-12 16:16:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I suppose my main concern was the inconsistency here with most of the other options being prefixed with 'rpc_' but this one being left out. Since we are making this change already I thought this would be a good chance to align them.

So long as we plan on moving towards the groups sooner I'm probably Okay with waiting I guess. We still have quite a ways to go to make projects like Nova fully adopt option groups though."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-12 16:16:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Dan makes a good point - calling it rpc_control_exchange would be better

I do want to use option groups more in Grizzly, but really we need to move all RPC options to an rpc group at once. Part of moving to option groups will be adding the ability to deprecate the old option names rather than remove them completely.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-12 16:16:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2012-09-12 16:16:04.000000000', 'message': "Make projects define 'control_exchange'.

The 'control_exchange' option needs to have a project-specific default
value.  Just don't register this option and expect it to be registered
by the project using this code, at least for now.

   ****** IMPORTANT NOTE WHEN IMPORTING THIS CHANGE ******

If you are importing this change into a project that uses rpc, you must
add the control_exchange option in your code!

   *******************************************************

Change-Id: Ida5a8637c419e709bbf22fcad57b0f11c31bb959
"}, {'created': '2012-09-12 16:16:04.000000000', 'message': "Make projects define 'rpc_control_exchange'.

The first thing this patch does is to rename 'control_exchange' to
'rpc_control_exchange' to be more consistent with other rpc options.
The old name is still supported for backwards compatibility.

The 'rpc_control_exchange' option needs to have a project-specific default
value.  Just don't register this option and expect it to be registered
by the project using this code, at least for now.

   ****** IMPORTANT NOTE WHEN IMPORTING THIS CHANGE ******

If you are importing this change into a project that uses rpc, you must
add the rpc_control_exchange option in your code!  You should also
consider supporting 'control_exchange' as a deprecated alias for
backwards compatibility, as shown in the commented out example in this
patch.

   *******************************************************

Change-Id: Ida5a8637c419e709bbf22fcad57b0f11c31bb959
"}, {'created': '2012-09-12 16:16:04.000000000', 'message': "Make projects define 'control_exchange'.

The 'control_exchange' option needs to have a project-specific default
value.  Just don't register this option and expect it to be registered
by the project using this code, at least for now.

   ****** IMPORTANT NOTE WHEN IMPORTING THIS CHANGE ******

If you are importing this change into a project that uses rpc, you must
add the control_exchange option in your code!

   *******************************************************

Change-Id: Ida5a8637c419e709bbf22fcad57b0f11c31bb959
"}]
commit_message:
Make projects define 'control_exchange'.

The 'control_exchange' option needs to have a project-specific default
value.  Just don't register this option and expect it to be registered
by the project using this code, at least for now.

   ****** IMPORTANT NOTE WHEN IMPORTING THIS CHANGE ******

If you are importing this change into a project that uses rpc, you must
add the control_exchange option in your code!

   *******************************************************

commit_message:
Delete user tokens after role grant/revoke

Delete user tokens when a new role is granted or revoked, in order to
prevent old tokens to continue to be valid for the original set of
roles for the remainder of the token's lifespan.

Addresses CVE-2012-4413.
Fixes bug 1041396.

Change-Id: Iecf891f274b67408f568b949a7028362c4c30312

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-12 13:54:46.000000000', 'message': "Make projects define 'control_exchange'.

The 'control_exchange' option needs to have a project-specific default
value.  Just don't register this option and expect it to be registered
by the project using this code, at least for now.

   ****** IMPORTANT NOTE WHEN IMPORTING THIS CHANGE ******

If you are importing this change into a project that uses rpc, you must
add the control_exchange option in your code!

   *******************************************************

Change-Id: Ida5a8637c419e709bbf22fcad57b0f11c31bb959
"}]
commit_message:
Make projects define 'control_exchange'.

The 'control_exchange' option needs to have a project-specific default
value.  Just don't register this option and expect it to be registered
by the project using this code, at least for now.

   ****** IMPORTANT NOTE WHEN IMPORTING THIS CHANGE ******

If you are importing this change into a project that uses rpc, you must
add the control_exchange option in your code!

   *******************************************************

Change-Id: Ida5a8637c419e709bbf22fcad57b0f11c31bb959

commit_message:
Add region_name support

Add --os-region-name (and OS_REGION_NAME env) to bin/swift
Add region_name to the os_options in Connection class.

bug 1019832

commit_message:
allow admin user to create VMs on tenant networks w/quantum

bug 1047742

When querying quantum about the set of valid networks for a
tenant, make sure a user with the admin context sees any tenant
network as valid.  We do this by removing the explicit
tenant_id filter in the request and instead relying on the
context logic.

Change-Id: I2c3a98b1474bf5d070e308db3cba564a2c9e0d7b

commit_message:
Stub additional FloatingIP methods in FlatManager

Fixes bug 989746.

Added some stub methods for floating ip allocation in FlatManager in
order to prevent exceptions from being raised when they are called.

Changed get_floating_ip_by_address() in FlatManager to return a dict
with expected keys for a floating ip, rather than None.

Change-Id: I3043ffe04f984189c8eee955a137dac6b83e7a0d

commit_message:
Add Project Testing Interface to stable/diablo.

Adds tox.ini, dependency files to bring this branch's testing
interface up to current standards.  Also removes rfc.sh and adds
.gitreview for convenience.

Changes the way an exception is raised in common/db.py to
match what's in stable/essex to satisfy pep8 compliance.

Change-Id: If15c99693990433cdda1a2023be8fe8024429c40

Implements blueprint ocf-support.

This change set adds the newly written OCF resource agents to Glance
in order to make it possible to run glance-api and glance-registry as
a resource managed by the Pacemaker cluster manager. Further details
about this agent (and the one for Keystone, too) can be found in this
extensive blog post I wrote when initially putting them up for testing:

http://www.hastexo.com/blogs/martin/2012/04/03/bringing-high-availability-openstack-keystone-and-glance

Change-Id: I001e274bcdc4e1da503059fcde01b1428160d049
'}]
commit_message:
Add an OCF resource agent to Glance.

Implements blueprint ocf-support.

This change set adds the newly written OCF resource agents to Glance
in order to make it possible to run glance-api and glance-registry as
a resource managed by the Pacemaker cluster manager. Further details
about this agent (and the one for Keystone, too) can be found in this
extensive blog post I wrote when initially putting them up for testing:

http://www.hastexo.com/blogs/martin/2012/04/03/bringing-high-availability-openstack-keystone-and-glance

Change-Id: I001e274bcdc4e1da503059fcde01b1428160d049

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-05 17:23:03.000000000', 'message': "Remove null_kernel option.

This option was only used in the image/fake.py class. In this patch
I've updated the fake to use an inline 'nokernel' string instead of
this option which we don't make use of in the runtime Cinder code.

Change-Id: I05d4f227f1278c827ace2ce3c62319f9b18d04d4
"}]
commit_message:
Remove null_kernel option.

This option was only used in the image/fake.py class. In this patch
I've updated the fake to use an inline 'nokernel' string instead of
this option which we don't make use of in the runtime Cinder code.

Change-Id: I05d4f227f1278c827ace2ce3c62319f9b18d04d4

commit_message:
Optionally faster 'nova show'

Running show against an instance UUID calls for the
instance/flavor/image data. This patch allows --minimal
to be passed and the extra lookups will be skipped.

Change-Id: I76e9ac58a67b7cb595ca08c173ec9758119b46ae

In this patch, I decided to implement a new interface driver OVSVethInterfaceDriver instead of extending the existing OVSInterfaceDriver. Though I agree that these two interface driver are similar and I can modify OVSInterfaceDriver to have different namespace device option, I prefer to keep a change to OVSInterfaceDriver smaller to avoid OVSInterfaceDriver degrade at this timing. OVSInterfaceDriver is used by OVS and Ryu plugin. Once Folsom is released, I am glad to integrate them into a single interface driver.

I tested it with DHCP agent and L3 agent in NEC plugin with namespace support.
From now, I starts a regression test using OVSInterfaceDriver.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-09-11 22:27:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-11 22:27:27.000000000', 'message': "Add a new interface driver OVSVethInterfaceDriver.

Fixes bug 1048681

This commit fixes a bug that quantum agent using a namespace does not
work with NEC plugin. NEC plugin uses an Open vSwitch as an OpenFlow switch,
but an OVS port created by ovs-vsctl add-port becomes down when the port is
moved to some network namespace. Usual OpenFlow controllers respect the
OpenFlow port status. Since DHCP server (dnsmasq) is connected to the down
port, DHCP server disappears from the virtual network.

This behavior can be avoided if we use a similar approach used in
BridgeInterfaceDriver, i.e., we first create a veth pair, add one veth device
to OVS and move the other veth device to a network namespace. To accomplish it
this patch introduces a new interface driver OVSVethInterfaceDriver.

In addition, this patch adds a 'prefix' paramter to unplug(). When deleting
a veth pair, a veth device added to OVS bridge is not removed automatically.
Thus we need a mean to know the veth device name from a device_name to be
removed. It is the reason to add 'prefix' parameter to unplug().

Change-Id: I3f4eae371a27a3171a6a8c9e38ddc9354ed1b6b0

commit_message:
Add a new interface driver OVSVethInterfaceDriver.

Fixes bug 1048681

This commit fixes a bug that quantum agent using a namespace does not
work with NEC plugin. NEC plugin uses an Open vSwitch as an OpenFlow switch,
but an OVS port created by ovs-vsctl add-port becomes down when the port is
moved to some network namespace. Usual OpenFlow controllers respect the
OpenFlow port status. Since DHCP server (dnsmasq) is connected to the down
port, DHCP server disappears from the virtual network.

This behavior can be avoided if we use a similar approach used in
BridgeInterfaceDriver, i.e., we first create a veth pair, add one veth device
to OVS and move the other veth device to a network namespace. To accomplish it
this patch introduces a new interface driver OVSVethInterfaceDriver.

In addition, this patch adds a 'prefix' paramter to unplug(). When deleting
a veth pair, a veth device added to OVS bridge is not removed automatically.
Thus we need a mean to know the veth device name from a device_name to be
removed. It is the reason to add 'prefix' parameter to unplug().

Change-Id: I3f4eae371a27a3171a6a8c9e38ddc9354ed1b6b0

commit_message:
Revert "Don't zero out snapshot volume on snapshot_delete"

This reverts commit 1b3322d45fe2c5ed72cc7f8674e5e319928065ad

Turns out that although it's less likely we can still see this issue when zeroing out regular volumes.

commit_message:
Don't zero out snapshot volume on snapshot_delete

 When trying to zero out an LVM snapshot on precise the kernel sometimes
 hangs when performing the dd.  Also the dd process itself can take
 an extremely long time even when it does succesfully complete.
 This can be up to 30 minutes for a 1 Gig volume/snapshot.

 I believe this is a kernel specific issue with LVM snapshots.  The
 zeroing process is unreliable and can cause kernel hangs to let's remove it.

 In order to protect against data leakage we'll implement the zeroing process
 on volume creation.  This doesn't seem to have a significant impact and doesn't
 suffer from the same isues tha zeroing out an LVM snapshot does.

 No reason to continue zero on delete, the zero on creation should
 probably be sufficient.

 Doesn't seem to cause any timing issues but need to keep this in mind.

 Fixes bug 1023755

Change-Id: I56209d8e5973cffa997b4ec3e51c3361838386de

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-08 21:50:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2012-09-08 22:02:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Verified snapshot delete issue is still present with the o-direct changes.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-09-08 22:12:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks for verifying with O_DIRECT.

The bug says "Ubuntu 11.10 is a better OS then Ubuntu 12.04",
so this is a kernel regression it seems. For reference has it been reported upstream or is there a tracker on launchpad for it?'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2012-09-11 14:14:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

How is zeroing on snapshot create rather than snapshot delete avoiding the kernel hang (or the very long time ?)

This sounds like a suboptimal solution to work around a bug that is not ours. The problem is a kernel regression in Ubuntu 12.04, it should be fixed there. Slowing down creates rather than deletes (and persisting user data on disk in the mean time) doesn't sound that great to me."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-11 21:15:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Related,  the patch for configurable wiping method : I7312678ff5d66156578501483a1b74e2a69e19a0'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-11 21:17:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Also - this is merged into cinder already, see I56209d8e5973cffa997b4ec3e51c3361838386de'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2012-09-11 21:38:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Initially it was believed that this kernel issue was only applicable to LVM snapshots.  Moving the zero out to volume creation was a good idea to avoid the kernel hang and still prevent data leakage, HOWEVER  it turns out that although it's significantly less frequent, the hang can occur on standard LVM volumes as well.

Also, this causes too many timing issues on volume create, the dd is far to erratic in terms of how long it takes.

ubuntu kernel team is aware of the issue and hopefully working on it."}]

commit_message:
Don't zero out snapshot volume on snapshot_delete

 When trying to zero out an LVM snapshot on precise the kernel sometimes
 hangs when performing the dd.  Also the dd process itself can take
 an extremely long time even when it does succesfully complete.
 This can be up to 30 minutes for a 1 Gig volume/snapshot.

 I believe this is a kernel specific issue with LVM snapshots.  The
 zeroing process is unreliable and can cause kernel hangs to let's remove it.

 In order to protect against data leakage we'll implement the zeroing process
 on volume creation.  This doesn't seem to have a significant impact and doesn't
 suffer from the same isues tha zeroing out an LVM snapshot does.

 No reason to continue zero on delete, the zero on creation should
 probably be sufficient.

 Doesn't seem to cause any timing issues but need to keep this in mind.

 Fixes bug 1023755

Change-Id: I87c3086736f65eb3b9e28868c9753867c7caffee

commit_message:
Add s3_store_bucket_url_format config option

Swift's implementation of the S3 interface doesn't support subdomain
access to containers. It requires that the bucket be prepended to the
request path. The option 's3_store_bucket_url_format' can be set to
either 'path' or 'subdomain' (default) to control how boto forms
the bucket url.

Fixes bug 997658

Change-Id: Ia6e1e7356eef7ac2267f7738e2f4a7c70dc12eeb

commit_message:
Improve logging of process id

Move process id to a fixed position in the logs, and to
be present for all output (including eventlet and stack traces)
as was the case previously.

Fix for LP bug 1040772.

Change-Id: I82639e730c2887630fbbee608a4d4da24862982d
(cherry picked from commit ab6ceb0679c47149b34ce96215db16f406fdd160)

container_info returns a dict

This change refactors container_info to return a dict instead of a tuple
with 6 (and counting...) values.

Also adds container size to cached info.

Change-Id: If68a06ab170504fbf07323354f3d0e073850493d

[{'created': '2012-08-20 07:20:42.000000000', 'message': "Fixes the bug created by the commit for 974916.

Fixes bug 974916.

Volumes are not properly scoped for admin users, where instances are.
Thus, if you're opening the page as an admin, viewing
instance->volume attachments created by anyone else, you're going
to be lacking the data you need via the instances object.

Change-Id: I085c8193a4bc850482b37005705913355dc95dca
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes the bug created by the commit for 974916.

Fixes bug 974916.

Volumes are not properly scoped for admin users, where instances are.
Thus, if you're opening the page as an admin, viewing
instance->volume attachments created by anyone else, you're going
to be lacking the data you need via the instances object.

Change-Id: I085c8193a4bc850482b37005705913355dc95dca

commit_message:
Improve logging of process id

Move process id to a fixed position in the logs, and to
be present for all output (including eventlet and stack traces)
as was the case previously.

Fix for LP bug 1040772.

Change-Id: I82639e730c2887630fbbee608a4d4da24862982d

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-11 18:29:15.000000000', 'message': 'Remove template comments from compressed blocks.

Template comment tags within compressed blocks throws off
checksum calculation with older versions of compressor. This
makes offline compression impossible and requires the pages
be rendered for every request with online compression.

Removing trivial comments from the compressed blocks ensures Horizon
is compatable with older versions (v1.1.2 shipping with Ubuntu).

Change-Id: I3a9f2614695b72445719101bfa2480384d77f3a4
'}]
commit_message:
Remove template comments from compressed blocks.

Template comment tags within compressed blocks throws off
checksum calculation with older versions of compressor. This
makes offline compression impossible and requires the pages
be rendered for every request with online compression.

Removing trivial comments from the compressed blocks ensures Horizon
is compatable with older versions (v1.1.2 shipping with Ubuntu).

Change-Id: I3a9f2614695b72445719101bfa2480384d77f3a4

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-10 20:40:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fallback to a temp pid file in glance-control

Fixes bug 1046593.

Previously if the pid file was not writeable by the current user
then glance-control bombs out, *after* spawning the required service
but *without* caching the process ID anywhere.

Now we fall back to a temporary file, so that at least user can supply
that file to the corresponding glance-contol stop command.

Change-Id: I6c1daf36221f731fdb5a8bb59d3f91a595337af8
'}, {'created': '2012-09-10 20:55:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fallback to a temp pid file in glance-control

Previously if the pid file was not writeable by the current user
then glance-control bombs out, *after* spawning the required service
but *without* caching the process ID anywhere.

Now we fall back to a temporary file, so that at least user can supply
that file to the corresponding glance-contol stop command.

Change-Id: I6c1daf36221f731fdb5a8bb59d3f91a595337af8
'}, {'created': '2012-09-10 21:11:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fallback to a temp pid file in glance-control

commit_message:
Fallback to a temp pid file in glance-control

Fixes bug 1046593.

Previously if the pid file was not writeable by the current user
then glance-control bombs out, *after* spawning the required service
but *without* caching the process ID anywhere.

Now we fall back to a temporary file, so that at least user can supply
that file to the corresponding glance-contol stop command.

Change-Id: I6c1daf36221f731fdb5a8bb59d3f91a595337af8

If they WANT to specify the port, however, they have to escape, because otherwise it's ambiguous (e.g. 2001:db8:85a3::8a2e:370:7334 can be [2001:db8:85a3::8a2e:370:7334] and can be [2001:db8:85a3::8a2e:370]:7334 which are both valid)."}, {'account_id': 4987, 'date': '2012-09-11 18:59:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-11 18:59:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

My last question is about returning the IPv6 address with brackets around it.  Do you know if that's the format expected by the future users of this function?  I would have thought it would expect the address without the square brackets, but I haven't tried it or anything."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-09-11 18:59:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I don't really have an opinion.  I'm mostly concerned with the users of this code. For example, you have another path that passes the result into kombu.  Does it accept an IPv6 address with and without square brackets to the "hostname" option?

I would actually vote for returning the address, as that seems a bit safer and more likely to be usable everywhere.'}, {'account_id': 4987, 'date': '2012-09-11 18:59:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Square brackets are optional, i.e. an address with brackets is still a valid address, so it's irrelevant whether we remove them or not.

Actually I'd rather opt for inserting brackets if they're missing :) just to be on the safe side in case someone uses the result as host + ':' + something. commit_message:
Added a method for parsing host:port pairs.

The method works correctly with ipv6.
An alternative way would be to use urlparse, but urlparse
only works correctly starting with Python 2.7, so to be
compatible, we have to reimplement this part.

The method will be used for parsing Glance API server
addresses, RabbitMQ addresses and perhaps other things.

Change-Id: Ie5014891c6abcd80681a370d5dd94cb0406f7f61

commit_message:
heat : test utils, extract ec2 credentials from keystone

For StackBoto extract the ec2 credentials from keystone and
pass them into the client, so the functional tests don't rely
on ec2 credentials from config-files and only need the currently
provided keystone credentials

Change-Id: Ifc959011cc5b9ee77ebf04e380dc6a4059903c6d
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2012-09-11 18:45:02.000000000', 'message': 'heat : comment credentials in template boto.cfg

Comment out the credentials section in /etc/boto.cfg
this allows us to pass the correct host/endpoint without
having world-readable credentials.  This can then be used
as a template for per-user ~/.boto files if desired

Change-Id: I4cea0cb3b790186ddc041edad0ab4ee4b7e8f956
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
heat : comment credentials in template boto.cfg

Comment out the credentials section in /etc/boto.cfg
this allows us to pass the correct host/endpoint without
having world-readable credentials.  This can then be used
as a template for per-user ~/.boto files if desired

Change-Id: I4cea0cb3b790186ddc041edad0ab4ee4b7e8f956
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

Added some tests for you, Iccha.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-11 15:50:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/12743/2/check/gate-glance-merge/2189 : SUCCESS

'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-09-11 16:19:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think there's still a small race that could occur if the deletion happens concurrently with an upload (e.g. a long async copy-from).

In that case the state transitions would be:

  queued--[delete]-->deleted--[upload completes]-->active

So I think that when activating an image, we'd need to check if its already deleted and in that case avoid the state transition to active and also delete the image data if any from the backend store.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-09-11 16:25:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

That sounds like a new bug we need to file and fix in the async copy_from code, not here. Is that reasonable?'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-09-11 16:38:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Yes, it would be reasonable to treat that race as a separate bug in the interests of getting the current fix in for RC1.

Cheers,

commit_message:
Ensure status of 'queued' image updated on delete

Images in 'queued' status (and those without a location attribute)
were not being updated with a status of 'deleted' when a DELETE
action was taken on them through both the v1 and v2 APIs. This
patch ensures that both APIs correctly update the images.

Fixes bug 1048851.

Change-Id: I9604d4ce5d59066fb108625df0fa114cc044d604

since commit 9e4242c3 which prepared for switching to common rpc.

commit_message:
Prevent Partial terminations in EC2

When passing in a valid and an invalid EC2 id, the API should not partially
execute the command, and instead just return an error.

Fix bug 979336

Also prevents partial:
* starts
* stops
* reboots

Change-Id: I28fb4f34aadfb7af14774db983d44584e61c5414

commit_message:
Ensure that l3 agent does not crash on restart

Fixes bug 1048108

The changeset also removed the namespace garbage collection from the port unplug. This
attempts to delete the namespace. This is problematic as there may be additional attributes
to the namespace that need to be dealt with.

Change-Id: I418a1ec4e9b65e5bea67ae84414019c3d6b54214

commit_message:
Add begin_detaching and roll_detaching functions

Fixes bug #1004382

If nova call nova.volume.cinder.API.begin_detaching and
nova.volume.cinder.API.roll_detaching, it need python_cinderclient
support the functions.

Change-Id: If5d00a7f7991d78243e76a6e22031c185caee80a
