commit_message:
heat tests : add new Boto wordpress functional test

Add new test_WordPress_Single_Instance_Boto.py, which
does a wordpress single instance test using StackBoto

Note, this will require a valid /etc/boto.cfg to work,
and probably a recent (git) version of boto

Fixes #220

Change-Id: Ia95de35dc9d1d52ba6b9f4fae333e4fad02762ca
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat tests : functional test utils add StackBoto class

Add StackBoto, subclass of Stack, which implements stack
setup using the boto client wrapper, allows us to test
AWS auth and boto client libraries

Ref #220

Change-Id: Id5cb5ab72c7ba2e7accd76a73a94ff8fe45c62fa
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-30 14:09:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for create volume from snapshot.

Add create volume from snapshot to the RBD driver,
this is already in cinder, so we just port this code

commit_message:
Add support for create volume from snapshot.

Add create volume from snapshot to the RBD driver,
this is already in cinder, so we just port this code
over from cinder.

LP: #1032405

Change-Id: I44d2e513eb0f9f207dc795860d642c9399e4ad61
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

Thanks for making these changes...

As a side comment, the behavior of 'user list' seems a little inconsistent as it returns an empty 'enabled' value (i.e. does not show True|False) where as a 'tenant list' returns True for enabled.

I know we are not storing the enabled flag in LDAP right now, but we are making the assumption that enabled is always True for LDAP backend entities. Therefore to me it might be cleaner to return/decorate enabled=True for LDAP based users in case consumers are looking for that flag.

Example outputs from CLI:
user-list -->
+----------------------------------+-------+---------+---------------+
|                id                |  name | enabled |     email     |
+----------------------------------+-------+---------+---------------+
| 58c03e98ade64f35bcd9afc1140fecf8 | admin |         | admin@abc.com |
| ab627c802b164bb3aaeca1ec66316514 | boden |         | boden@abc.com |
+----------------------------------+-------+---------+---------------+

tenant-list -->
+----------------------------------+-------------+---------+
|                id                |     name    | enabled |
+----------------------------------+-------------+---------+
| 4e233cd714f54642932c85d2677885b6 | LDAPTenant5 |   True  |
| 871d3f58932142f59f3f9be66a68f2d2 | ldapTenant1 |   True  |
| fd0ff2ac28de4babb1ad72a3b484d720 | LDAPTenant3 |   True  |
+----------------------------------+-------------+---------+"}]

commit_message:
Implementation of tenant,user,role list functions for ldap

Bug 983304

Defines functions for the retrival and return of the tenant, user and
role objects in ldap.  They will return in whatever order LDAP provides
them.

Additional fix for pep8 whitespace violation.

Additional change to add some minimal unit tests for the new functions
Tests have successfully run against a live LDAP server

Change-Id: I368ae4097bb9bcdaab7bca0ccc2f9204d58f69d8

commit_message:
Adding structure for Operations Manual

for:
bp openstack-operations-manual

Adding a structure and a bit of padding text for an eventual
OpenStack operations manual, based on:
http://etherpad.openstack.org/EssexOperationsGuide

patch2: adding a random README to make the figures directory stick

patch3: changed license in book from apache2 to cc-by-nc-sa
but also asking Pearson if that is their intent.

patch4: Pearson okay with cc-by-sa for these chapters.

Change-Id: I34a2e36af98b59f78c828bb3b265ca736ad2df0b

commit_message:
Adding Network creation to OS API docs

fixes bug 1039114

As in the bug report: There's a new network creation call in the
compute API. This patch adds it in with some example requests and
responses.

Patch2: rebases after change that introduce add network

Change-Id: Ib3a5499aa9c0b3f05cc8d2b1b959ccfc460f1057

commit_message:
make subnets attribute of a network read-only

bug 1046173

writing to the subnets attribute is not supported, so rather than
making it looks like we accept it but ignoring it, we should explicitly
reject requests to specify it on network create/update.

Change-Id: I5b6f0f35794c9d5606befb97a89c6c6c97ee3dbf

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-11 08:46:09.000000000', 'message': 'Ensures that the Linux Bridge Plugin runs with L3 agent

Fixes bug 1048968

1. The external interface for the linux bridge will be created at run time.
The configuration parameter external_network_bridge should be set as empty.
That is, "external_network_bridge = ". The link between the network and
the physical interface should be done via the provider network parameters.
2. The plug operation for the linux bridge replaces the interface name
prefix with tap. We need to ensure that the prefix length is 3 characters.

Change-Id: Ib8e26bc1f603a1aff9560b4a40110a6824db5921
'}]
commit_message:
Ensures that the Linux Bridge Plugin runs with L3 agent

Fixes bug 1048968

1. The external interface for the linux bridge will be created at run time.
The configuration parameter external_network_bridge should be set as empty.
That is, "external_network_bridge = ". The link between the network and
the physical interface should be done via the provider network parameters.
2. The plug operation for the linux bridge replaces the interface name
prefix with tap. We need to ensure that the prefix length is 3 characters.

Change-Id: Ib8e26bc1f603a1aff9560b4a40110a6824db5921

subject: Add healthcheck middleware from Swift
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-11 08:25:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-merge/418/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-pep8/286/consoleFull : SUCCESS

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python27/286/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-11 08:25:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-11 08:25:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-11 08:25:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Paul

What does this provide over doing e.g. HEAD on the toplevel entry point of the service?

Do you plan on importing the middleware into Glance and Nove if it is accepted in common? Do we then include it in the API specification of those services?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-11 08:25:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Paul - I think this would be good to discuss on openstack-dev

i.e. interested to hear other peoples' opinions on whether:

1) this is more useful than e.g. HEAD on '/'
2) all projects will be willing to enable it by default
3) the API specs will need updating to include"}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2012-09-11 08:25:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Mark, thanks for looking at this change.  

> What does this provide over doing e.g. HEAD on the toplevel entry point of the service?  

It provides a consistent, low  level, point of diagnosis across services that use this middleware.
This can help with fault isolation, being one level up from checking that there is a listening socket, and one level down from a 'full' API request. (Currently, a HEAD on the top level of Glance seems to hang with a 300; while the heathcheck succeeds with 200, so the healthcheck can detect this type of intermediate state.)
It also avoids using other pieces of middleware such as the list of API versions for dual purposes.  
  
  
> Do you plan on importing the middleware into Glance and Nove if it is accepted in common? Do we then include it in the API specification of those services?  

Its currently documented for Swift; we'd like to see this in Glance/Nova too, though it's up to each team's PTL."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-11 08:25:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

To be clear on the status of this ...

There was pretty minimal discussion on list - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-August/000614.html

Not much in the way of anyone convinced about either approach

I'd really have liked to have seen input from the owners of the API specs of each service as to whether they'd prefer to include /healthcheck in those APIs

In the absence of that input, I suspect it's much more feasible to get all projects to support HEAD on the toplevel entrypoint"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-11 08:25:31.000000000', 'message': "Add healthcheck middleware from Swift

Swift contains a small piece of middleware that can be used as a first
port of call to determine if the service is responding.

To use it, one should prepend 'healthcheck' to the front of the
application pipeline, and add a filter section to the paste config that
looks something like the following:

[filter:healthcheck]
paste.filter_factory = foo.common.middleware.healthcheck:filter_factory

(where foo is the service in question, e.g. swift, glance, etc.)

Implements blueprint port-swift-healthcheck.

Change-Id: I2ccec53f879a760c10964f3b2cc99e5c1a6c8663
"}]
commit_message:
Add healthcheck middleware from Swift

Swift contains a small piece of middleware that can be used as a first
port of call to determine if the service is responding.

To use it, one should prepend 'healthcheck' to the front of the
application pipeline, and add a filter section to the paste config that
looks something like the following:

[filter:healthcheck]
paste.filter_factory = foo.common.middleware.healthcheck:filter_factory

(where foo is the service in question, e.g. swift, glance, etc.)

Implements blueprint port-swift-healthcheck.

Change-Id: I2ccec53f879a760c10964f3b2cc99e5c1a6c8663

Additionally, I cannot see how this change fixes the issue you identify in the commit message; could you explain that a little bit better?"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-09-10 14:35:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Thanks for the patch Yunhong,

One small nitpick inline, also as pointed out before, please propose to openstack-common first.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-09-11 03:04:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks for reviews. I will move it to openstack common.

Kevin, the patch works as followed way:

if timestamp is a naive datetime object, timestamp.utcoffset() will get None. Otherwise, if timestamp is a UTC aware datetime object, timestamp.utcoffset() will get timedelta(0). Because "if  timedelta(0)" return False, then if timestamp is a UTC aware datetime object, it will be returned as is, i.e. still aware object.

By change from "if offset" to "if offset is not None", we will return "timestamp.replace(tzinfo=None)" for UTC timestamp, which is naive object.

Hope this make thing clear.'}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-09-11 08:20:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Moved to openstack common. Abandoned.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-10 13:32:17.000000000', 'message': 'Normalize_time() always return naive object

Currently the timeutils.normalize_time() return naive datetime
object when parameter timestamp is an naive object or a non-UTC
aware datetime object, and will return aware datetime object if
parameter timestamp is a UTC aware datttime object.

This is fragile implementation and will trigger potential issue, because
aware/native datetime is not interoperatable. For example,
"timeutils.utcnow() > timeutils.normalize_time(m)" will success at most
time, while trigger TypeError if m is a UTC aware object.

Change-Id: Icdca6a52a163b4c2f1e372348a5d6f6b9733909b
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
'}, {'created': '2012-09-10 13:34:19.000000000', 'message': 'Normalize_time() always return naive object

Currently the timeutils.normalize_time() return naive datetime
object when parameter timestamp is an naive object or a non-UTC
aware datetime object, and will return aware datetime object if
parameter timestamp is a UTC aware datttime object.

This is fragile implementation and will trigger potential issue, because
aware/native datetime is not interoperatable. For example,
"timeutils.utcnow() > timeutils.normalize_time(m)" will success at most
time, while trigger TypeError if m is a UTC aware object.

Fixes bug 1048636

Change-Id: Icdca6a52a163b4c2f1e372348a5d6f6b9733909b
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Normalize_time() always return naive object

Currently the timeutils.normalize_time() return naive datetime
object when parameter timestamp is an naive object or a non-UTC
aware datetime object, and will return aware datetime object if
parameter timestamp is a UTC aware datttime object.

This is fragile implementation and will trigger potential issue, because
aware/native datetime is not interoperatable. For example,
"timeutils.utcnow() > timeutils.normalize_time(m)" will success at most
time, while trigger TypeError if m is a UTC aware object.

Fixes bug 1048636

Change-Id: Icdca6a52a163b4c2f1e372348a5d6f6b9733909b
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

[{'created': '2012-09-11 06:27:13.000000000', 'message': 'Add enable_tunneling openvswitch configuration variable

Not all systems that support Open vSwitch support its GRE tunneling
feature that is not in the Linux kernel source tree. Therefore, a new
configuration variable, enable_tunneling, applies to both the server
and agent. Its default value is False, so it must be set to True to
enable tunneling for tenant and/or provider networks. If
enable_tunneling is False, the server will not allow creation of GRE
networks, and the agent will not initialize the tunnel bridge and will
log an error if there is an attempt to provision a GRE network. If it
is True, the agent now logs an error and exits if it fails to
initialize the patch ports used for the tunnel bridge. Fixes bug
1045610.

When there is an attempt to provision a flat or VLAN network and the
agent has no bridge mapping configured for a the specified physical
network, the agent will now log an error rather than crash.

An undefined variable in a logging statement has been corrected.

Logging levels for openvswitch have been checked and updated where
necessary, and logging statements now avoid the % string substitution
syntax. Fixes bug 1045592.

The corresponding devstack update has already been merged.

Change-Id: I149db182dd132cc05802dcb20c6b552e293664a5

commit_message:
Add enable_tunneling openvswitch configuration variable

Not all systems that support Open vSwitch support its GRE tunneling
feature that is not in the Linux kernel source tree. Therefore, a new
configuration variable, enable_tunneling, applies to both the server
and agent. Its default value is False, so it must be set to True to
enable tunneling for tenant and/or provider networks. If
enable_tunneling is False, the server will not allow creation of GRE
networks, and the agent will not initialize the tunnel bridge and will
log an error if there is an attempt to provision a GRE network. If it
is True, the agent now logs an error and exits if it fails to
initialize the patch ports used for the tunnel bridge. Fixes bug
1045610.

When there is an attempt to provision a flat or VLAN network and the
agent has no bridge mapping configured for a the specified physical
network, the agent will now log an error rather than crash.

An undefined variable in a logging statement has been corrected.

Logging levels for openvswitch have been checked and updated where
necessary, and logging statements now avoid the % string substitution
syntax. Fixes bug 1045592.

The corresponding devstack update has already been merged.

Change-Id: I149db182dd132cc05802dcb20c6b552e293664a5

commit_message:
Fix HostAPI.get_host_uptime()

Fixes bug 1039628

'host' argument wasn't being passed to compute manager, which required
it.

'host' doesn't need to be passed to the compute manager for any of the
HostAPI methods, and it appears there's a bunch of inconsistencies
around this where someone fixed some of these in the past.

This patch cleans all of that up.

Change-Id: Id9471eefc96664188acfffabe71b9ebf04cfda20

commit_message:
Adds 'inflight' method call to rpc proxy base.

This method is currently only supported in nova services, but
once nova.manager moves into openstack.common it'll be available
everywhere. Sadly, there's no way to middleground this.

related branch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/11179/

Change-Id: I7b17db612493c7ac12b544fa647b3d5cc1eb1e00

commit_message:
Make attaching/detattching volumes more robust

Improve error handing for users when attaching/detaching
volumes using the EC2 API. This makes it easier to figure
out what is going on with the volumes if something goes
wrong.

Change-Id: I4b63502bba7e7c27845806e11a11f5e8e5dde008
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Add import_driver for entry_points driver classes.

Based on some work in Nova to add the capability to provide drivers via
entry points rather than via import_object_ns. This will first try to load
the given value using entrypoints, and then failing that, will try via
the old python path-based approach.

Change-Id: I88fd1ff150e5829bbf589a56eabad6e51ba662b4

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-11 05:58:55.000000000', 'message': 'Implement the AWS::S3::Bucket resource type.

An attempt was made to make created bucket names readable and unique.
Names are of the format heat-<resource name>-<random hex>. eg:
heat-S3Bucket-b420d12d02e5d6e46f13

Only the swift v2 auth is currently supported, which means swift will need to
use keystone for auth. This may be a valid assumption for any environment that
is running Heat.

When DeletionPolicy is Delete then an attempt is made to delete the container,
but the stack will still be deleted if container delete fails.

Run the template S3_Single_Instance.template to give it a try.

Functional tests will be coming in a later change.

Change-Id: Ifa2c3c4fcbdb00a44f8c6b347a61f8e1735e8328'}, {'created': '2012-09-11 05:58:55.000000000', 'message': 'Implement the AWS::S3::Bucket resource type.

An attempt was made to make created bucket names readable and unique.
Names are of the format heat-<resource name>-<random hex>. eg:
heat-S3Bucket-b420d12d02e5d6e46f13

Only the swift v2 auth is currently supported, which means swift will need to
use keystone for auth. This may be a valid assumption for any environment that
is running Heat.

When DeletionPolicy is Delete then an attempt is made to delete the container,
but the stack will still be deleted if container delete fails.

Run the template S3_Single_Instance.template to give it a try.

Functional tests will be coming in a later change.

Change-Id: Ifa2c3c4fcbdb00a44f8c6b347a61f8e1735e8328
'}]
commit_message:
Implement the AWS::S3::Bucket resource type.

An attempt was made to make created bucket names readable and unique.
Names are of the format heat-<resource name>-<random hex>. eg:
heat-S3Bucket-b420d12d02e5d6e46f13

Only the swift v2 auth is currently supported, which means swift will need to
use keystone for auth. This may be a valid assumption for any environment that
is running Heat.

When DeletionPolicy is Delete then an attempt is made to delete the container,
but the stack will still be deleted if container delete fails.

Run the template S3_Single_Instance.template to give it a try.

Functional tests will be coming in a later change.

Change-Id: Ifa2c3c4fcbdb00a44f8c6b347a61f8e1735e8328

commit_message:
Handle missing network_size in nova-manage

In 'nova-manage network create' --network_size should be optional.

Fixes bug 1046605

Change-Id: I25ce9acbe664810aa8fe9a3b4a2951c0fac4e41a

commit_message:
Remove an external port when an error occurs during FIP creation.

Fixes bug 1048140

To remove an external port, we need to use the same context used
when it is created.

Change-Id: Ia89b086b420741e7e0e92625b62e46fcfe9dbbba

messages:

Build successful

'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-09-11 03:41:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

bob, I agree with your comment, though I think the confusion may be more how the git commit message is worded.  Maybe we should say:

"This patch adds a periodic check to the DHCP agent that will resync state with the quantum server if any notification or rpc errors have occurred".'}, {'account_id': 704, 'date': '2012-09-11 03:41:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

waiting for Mark to change the commit message and address Dan's suggestion"}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-09-11 03:41:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

OK, I was confused by the commit message wording, and am OK with Dan's suggested wording.

I also agree with Dan's comment about the redundant call to get_active_networks()."}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-09-11 03:41:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Unless I missed something, needs_resync is only ever set to True when an exception occurs. Therefore, I don't think this will actually periodically resync the state. The eventlet thread only serves to limit the rate at which the agent will attempt to sync when errors keep occurring. Is this the intended behavior, or do we want to periodically resync even when no errors are detected within the agent?"}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-09-11 03:41:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-09-11 03:41:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Thanks for the feedback.  I've also updated the commit message per Dan's suggestion."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-09-11 03:41:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Normally the agent stays in sync via notifications.  We only need to resync when rpc/notification processing exceptions occur.   The resync thread just runs to coalesce the resync into one chunk of work vs tracking which items need updating.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-11 03:41:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

commit_message:
Add periodic check resync check to DHCP agent

fixes bug 1047605

This patch adds a periodic resync check to the DHCP agent that will
resync state with the Quantum server if any notification or rpc errors
have occurred since the last check.

Change-Id: I879662ff44f2991cd2ff07062bb4e770a2981528

Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 4987, 'date': '2012-09-06 17:55:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Also I'd suggest adding a comment around that "count > 255" so that people understand why this is even necessary (because of query size limit).'}, {'account_id': 3217, 'date': '2012-09-10 18:56:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'd skip the range-based option for now.  There's another proposed change (which I don't think is going anywhere either right now or in the current form) to store IP addresses in the DB in numeric form.  If we did something like that in Grizzly, we would have much neater range queries on IP addresses, and that would be a better moment to change this code around."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-09-10 20:54:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Eugene -- the addresses are stored as strings, so range queries are hard. I toyed with something involving regexps, but that seemed overly complicated.

commit_message:
Improve floating IP delete speed.

This is similar to the change to improve bulk creation speed. Before:

./bin/nova-manage floating delete --ip_range 10.250.0.0/16
337.20user 10.22system 44:07.10elapsed 13%CPU (0avgtext+0avgdata 119536maxresident)k
400inputs+0outputs (4major+11704minor)pagefaults 0swaps

commit_message:
Fix keystone_data.sh to match default_catalog.templates

Endpoint creating in keystone_data.sh tends to drift because
KEYSTONE_CATALOG_BACKEND=sql is not the default.

This patch should bring them closer together, and fix a problem I was having
with keystone auth

Change-Id: Ifac57b8e69234975d1ff65ace72d46d3a5808119

subject: Specified Content-Length in update request header
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-06 07:58:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/12491/1/check/gate-python-glanceclient-merge/361 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/12491/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/564 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-09-06 18:12:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

I'm not sure how setting Content-Length fixes the bug. The ImageDeserializer will look for Content-Length and then for 'size' in the image metadata."}, {'account_id': 3085, 'date': '2012-09-06 20:19:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

"os-volume_upload_image" volume action was failing with following error "Error communication with v1/images : [Errno 32] Broken pipe" before, Now after using this patch, I could able to copy volume to image successfully.

P.S. Tested using ISCSI volume driver.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-09-06 22:04:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

is the lack of a Content-Length header causing something different to happen down in the http layer?'}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-09-07 05:49:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Brian: Setting the Content-Length causes the 'has_body' check in Glance ImageDeserializer (https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/v1/images.py#L849 and https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/common/wsgi.py#L454) to return True. This prevents the image data from getting set to None (as was happening earlier, inspite of the data being available). Also, the patch description would give you more details.
Therefore, providing the Content-Length solves the problem."}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-09-10 06:30:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Brian: The HTTPConnection request( ) method calls the _set_content_length( ) method to set the content-length header, before sending out a request. The _set_content_length( ) method (snippet from httplib.py: http://paste.openstack.org/show/20797/) sets the content-length header to incorrect value '0', since os.fstat( ) returns a 'st_size' 0 for symbolic link file. The _set_content_length( ) method is not aware of the file type and hence calls os.fstat( ) instead of os.lstat( ) (in this particular case).
Therefore, the image data gets ignored during an update image request for a volume and returns an error on the sender (glanceclient) end."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-09-10 15:46:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Ok, this is still a little bit over my head, but I'll trust that it fixes your problem."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-09-10 23:08:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-10 23:09:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-10 23:38:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/12491/1/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/1070 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-10 23:38:06.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-06 07:41:29.000000000', 'message': "Specified Content-Length in update request header

While uploading a Volume to an image, the HTTPConnection's request method does
not set the Content-Length header (since the volume file is a sym link i.e. the
os.fstat call returns a st_size of 0). This causes Volume uploads to Glance
fail (since the image data is ignored as no content-length is specified).
Therefore setting the Content-Length from update( ) method if the image data is
provided.

Fixes LP: #1045824

Change-Id: If259fc5a338e3e90214a52b773132ed901691c0f
"}]
commit_message:
Specified Content-Length in update request header

While uploading a Volume to an image, the HTTPConnection's request method does
not set the Content-Length header (since the volume file is a sym link i.e. the
os.fstat call returns a st_size of 0). This causes Volume uploads to Glance
fail (since the image data is ignored as no content-length is specified).
Therefore setting the Content-Length from update( ) method if the image data is
provided.

Fixes LP: #1045824

Change-Id: If259fc5a338e3e90214a52b773132ed901691c0f

commit_message:
Catches HTTP 300 while printing responses

If glance v1 api is not enabled, and a request is made to it,
it gives a KeyError. This patch catches the 300 error and
displays error message.

Fixes bug 1046607

Change-Id: I0009a5deca3b5dd5ccaeaea90feee21274bfe090

commit_message:
prevent floatingip-show and floatingip-delete from querying by "name"

bug 1048088

floating IPs do not have names, but the show and delete commands
inherited logic that implied that they did, leading to very odd results
that would result is "floating-ip show X" return a result even if X
was not a valid UUID for any floating IP.

Change-Id: I5939a2a28ae4abf94d44fadb75a657fe706f1295

commit_message:
Add a criteria to sort a list of dict in api samples

Add 'key' parameter in the sorted call to order the list of dictionaries by a
specified criteria: the __tag__ value.
So far the sorted method considered an unspecified criteria (it seems it
considered the whole dict content) when ordering and this was causing some few
cases fail.

Change-Id: I1ebb295a7a3a53267e8f9f4286093f5b63d48eb3

Fixes bug 1040332.

Change-Id: I95f3dca651d2e72fc727646580092a25f558d6ba
'}, {'created': '2012-09-10 14:29:28.000000000', 'message': 'xapi: Populate vdi_map for VM.migrate_send and VM.assert_can_migrate

Fixes bug 1040332.

Change-Id: I95f3dca651d2e72fc727646580092a25f558d6ba
'}, {'created': '2012-09-10 15:32:29.000000000', 'message': 'xapi: Fix live block migration

Fixes bug 1040332.

Xapi VM.migrate_send and VM.assert_can_migrate calls require that
vdi_map parameter is a (source_vdi_ref -> target_sr_ref) mapping, for block
live migration to work, as of XenServer 6.0 RC1.

On the destination side:
This fix modifies the check_can_live_migrate_destination call, so that the
value returned contains the "destination_sr_ref" (XenAPI specific data is
stored under the "migrate_send_data key").

On the source side:
check_can_live_migrate_source and live_migrate calls assemble the
vdi_map by mapping all the local sr contained vdis of the VM to
destination_sr_ref, and passing this parameter to the VM.migrate_send and
VM.assert_can_migrate Xapi calls.

Change-Id: I95f3dca651d2e72fc727646580092a25f558d6ba
'}]
commit_message:
xapi: Fix live block migration

Fixes bug 1040332.

Xapi VM.migrate_send and VM.assert_can_migrate calls require that
vdi_map parameter is a (source_vdi_ref -> target_sr_ref) mapping, for block
live migration to work, as of XenServer 6.0 RC1.

On the destination side:
This fix modifies the check_can_live_migrate_destination call, so that the
value returned contains the "destination_sr_ref" (XenAPI specific data is
stored under the "migrate_send_data key").

On the source side:
check_can_live_migrate_source and live_migrate calls assemble the
vdi_map by mapping all the local sr contained vdis of the VM to
destination_sr_ref, and passing this parameter to the VM.migrate_send and
VM.assert_can_migrate Xapi calls.

Change-Id: I95f3dca651d2e72fc727646580092a25f558d6ba

commit_message:
Make size optional when creating a volume from a snapshot.

This patch makes the field optional, defaulting to the same
size as the snapshot (and therefore the origination volume).

Mirror of change I3fea7fe1c0415d10e549c66a242cf2a336a7204e from
Cinder.

Change-Id: I940a048ecf8a7b8212fa4945e3aadf2de8176554
Signed-off-by: Matthew Treinish <treinish@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-06 00:11:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix simple_tenant_usage's handing of future end times

Fixes bug #1043999

simple_tenant_usage returns the usage in the range between the supplied
start and end query parameters. The _hours_for() method calculates the
number of hours the instance was running in this range, even if the end time
is in the future.

By default, python-novaclient requests usage between 4 weeks ago and tomorrow.
This means we a report which accounts for 24 hours of extra running time for
each currently running instance. Fix this by clamping the period of the
returned report at the current time.

Change-Id: I61c211fd85b729aaeaac6ef24644ee19eb5bb6b0
(cherry picked from commit 869443f41c8826c9a4de1dcc65c5a5354b623a04)
"}, {'created': '2012-09-06 21:36:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix simple_tenant_usage's handing of future end times

Fixes bug #1043999

simple_tenant_usage returns the usage in the range between the supplied
start and end query parameters. The _hours_for() method calculates the
number of hours the instance was running in this range, even if the end time
is in the future.

By default, python-novaclient requests usage between 4 weeks ago and tomorrow.
This means we a report which accounts for 24 hours of extra running time for
each currently running instance. Fix this by clamping the period of the
returned report at the current time.

Change-Id: I61c211fd85b729aaeaac6ef24644ee19eb5bb6b0
(cherry picked from commit 869443f41c8826c9a4de1dcc65c5a5354b623a04)

commit_message:
Fix simple_tenant_usage's handing of future end times

Fixes bug #1043999

simple_tenant_usage returns the usage in the range between the supplied
start and end query parameters. The _hours_for() method calculates the
number of hours the instance was running in this range, even if the end time
is in the future.

By default, python-novaclient requests usage between 4 weeks ago and tomorrow.
This means we a report which accounts for 24 hours of extra running time for
each currently running instance. Fix this by clamping the period of the
returned report at the current time.

Change-Id: I61c211fd85b729aaeaac6ef24644ee19eb5bb6b0
(cherry picked from commit 869443f41c8826c9a4de1dcc65c5a5354b623a04)

commit_message:
Update documentation on configuring metadata server

The docs need to reflect the fact that the metadata server cannot be
configured and launched until after Nova has created the virtual bridge
interface.

See issue #196

Change-Id: Ia1a004106fa2b535b54c7b88e8ed177e47e72844
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-28 16:05:57.000000000', 'message': 'Identity API v3

- New v3 Routers (largely consolidated from v2.0)
- New v3 Controllers using dependency injection
- Revised keystone.conf.sample
- Full CRUD on all v3 collections
  (Services, Endpoints, Domains, Projects, Users, Credentials, Policies)
- v3 catalog tests (bug 1023933)
- v3 catalog implementation (bug 1023938)
- v3 policy (bp rbac-keystone-api)
- v3 policy tests (bug 1023935)
- v3 policy implementation (bug 1023939)
- v3 identity tests (bug 1023930)
- v3 identity implementation (bug 1023937)

Pending:
- SQL Migrations
- /tokens
- More tests!
- New client tests are dependent on corresponding client changes

Change-Id: I97c5a2f7a84e3fca0adaea020697f958e04f5753

commit_message:
Identity API v3 Config, Routers, Controllers

Provides configuration to deploy the v3 API identically across both:

http://[...]:5000/v3/
http://[...]:35357/v3/

Change-Id: I97c5a2f7a84e3fca0adaea020697f958e04f5753

commit_message:
Nail the pip requirement at 1.1.

The most recent version of pip (1.2.1 as of a couple days ago) fails
to install the required Cinder .venv packages. Nailing the installed
pip version when using run_tests.sh seems like a reasonable solution
to this issue.

Fixes LP Bug #1047120.

Change-Id: I8d831f747b0d25b5d0f6e74a234e764ff448965b

commit_message:
Show instances built from deleted snapshots

novaclient current throws an image not found error when you use the 'show'
command against an instance that was built from a snapshot which was
subsequently deleted.

Change-Id: If950b4582d0af9947c30fb24eea78a0829edecf3

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-07 15:54:04.000000000', 'message': "Handle missing 'provider_location' in rm_export.

Updates the remove_export function in the ISCSIDriver so that
it handles the case where provider_location isn't set on
a volume. This can occur if a volume is created but not exported.

This was a regression from a previous commit
(66f6a9edce3ccd624aba5d2a6bf3362901ed57f7) which changed the way
iscsi targets are created/deleted.

With this commit the Nova Smoke Test volume tests should once
again pass.

Fixes LP Bug #1046484.

Change-Id: I4539d73691a058d8fdc6c864dee06c0d4e4813f7
"}, {'created': '2012-09-07 17:06:11.000000000', 'message': "Handle missing 'provider_location' in rm_export.

Updates the remove_export function in the ISCSIDriver so that
it handles the case where provider_location isn't set on
a volume. This can occur if a volume is created but not exported.

This was a regression from a previous commit
(66f6a9edce3ccd624aba5d2a6bf3362901ed57f7) which changed the way
iscsi targets are created/deleted.

With this commit the Nova Smoke Test volume tests should once
again pass.

Fixes LP Bug #1046484.

Change-Id: I4539d73691a058d8fdc6c864dee06c0d4e4813f7
"}]
commit_message:
Handle missing 'provider_location' in rm_export.

Updates the remove_export function in the ISCSIDriver so that
it handles the case where provider_location isn't set on
a volume. This can occur if a volume is created but not exported.

This was a regression from a previous commit
(66f6a9edce3ccd624aba5d2a6bf3362901ed57f7) which changed the way
iscsi targets are created/deleted.

With this commit the Nova Smoke Test volume tests should once
again pass.

Fixes LP Bug #1046484.

Change-Id: I4539d73691a058d8fdc6c864dee06c0d4e4813f7

Initialize Metadata variable

Otherwise, Metadata hands back as None, which breaks later on in the
Authentication process. This is how the SQL backend worksi as well.

Bug 1047848

commit_message:
Nail the pip requirement at 1.1.

The most recent version of pip (1.2.1 as of a couple days ago) fails
to install the required Nova .venv packages. Nailing the installed
pip version when using run_tests.sh seems like a reasonable solution
to this issue.

Fixes LP Bug #1047120.

Change-Id: Ic947c04603cf9423c0cf2835351785d4fe795c4b

Adds get_available_resource to hyperv driver

Fixes Bug #1048263

update_available_resource was changed to get_available_resource.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-10 13:55:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix auth parameter passed to libvirt openAuth() method

The 'auth' parameter for the libvirt 'openAuth' method
should be a list of 3 values, a list of credential types,
a function callback and an opaque data value. For unknown
reasons the libvirt driver is passing the string 'root'
instead of the function callback.

This causes any attempt to invoke the callback to fail
with a python exception, which gets swallowed since it
is called asynchronously from libvirt. The upshot of
this is that it is not possible to connect Nova to a
libvirt instance that requires authentication.

Although Nova has no way to provide custom credentials
to libvirt, it is possible to rely on libvirt's client
auth file to provide credentials. ALl that is required
is for the auth callback to return '0' if no credentials
were asked for.

Fixing the Nova params for openAuth() thus enable use of
SASL or Kerberos auth+encryption with Nova eg for SASL

 # augtool -s set /files/etc/libvirt/libvirtd.conf/auth_unix_rw sasl
 Saved 1 file(s)

 # saslpasswd -a libvirt nova
 Password: XYZ
 Again (for verification): XYZ

 # su - nova -s /bin/sh
 $ mkdir -p $HOME/.config/libvirt
 $ cat > $HOME/.config/libvirt <<EOF
 [credentials-nova]
 authname=nova
 password=XYZ

 [auth-libvirt-localhost]
 credentials=nova
 EOF

Finally just restart libvirtd and nova compute services

Change-Id: I011b406e54728a01eb90a7851ae2b1f536674197
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2012-09-10 15:15:35.000000000', 'message': "Fix auth parameter passed to libvirt openAuth() method

The 'auth' parameter for the libvirt 'openAuth' method
should be a list of 3 values, a list of credential types,

instead of the function callback.

This causes any attempt to invoke the callback to fail

is called asynchronously from libvirt. The upshot of
this is that it is not possible to connect Nova to a
libvirt instance that requires authentication.

Although Nova has no way to provide custom credentials
to libvirt, it is possible to rely on libvirt's client
auth file to provide credentials. ALl that is required
is for the auth callback to return '0' if no credentials
were asked for.

Fixing the Nova params for openAuth() thus enable use of
SASL or Kerberos auth+encryption with Nova eg for SASL

 # augtool -s set /files/etc/libvirt/libvirtd.conf/auth_unix_rw sasl
 Saved 1 file(s)

 # saslpasswd -a libvirt nova
 Password: XYZ
 Again (for verification): XYZ

 # su - nova -s /bin/sh
 $ mkdir -p $HOME/.config/libvirt
 $ cat > $HOME/.config/libvirt <<EOF
 [credentials-nova]
 authname=nova
 password=XYZ

 [auth-libvirt-localhost]
 credentials=nova
 EOF

Finally just restart libvirtd and nova compute services

Change-Id: I011b406e54728a01eb90a7851ae2b1f536674197
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix auth parameter passed to libvirt openAuth() method

The 'auth' parameter for the libvirt 'openAuth' method
should be a list of 3 values, a list of credential types,
a function callback and an opaque data value. For unknown
reasons the libvirt driver is passing the string 'root'
instead of the function callback.

This causes any attempt to invoke the callback to fail
with a python exception, which gets swallowed since it
is called asynchronously from libvirt. The upshot of
this is that it is not possible to connect Nova to a
libvirt instance that requires authentication.

Although Nova has no way to provide custom credentials
to libvirt, it is possible to rely on libvirt's client
auth file to provide credentials. ALl that is required
is for the auth callback to return '0' if no credentials
were asked for.

Fixing the Nova params for openAuth() thus enable use of
SASL or Kerberos auth+encryption with Nova eg for SASL

 # augtool -s set /files/etc/libvirt/libvirtd.conf/auth_unix_rw sasl
 Saved 1 file(s)

 # saslpasswd -a libvirt nova
 Password: XYZ
 Again (for verification): XYZ

 # su - nova -s /bin/sh
 $ mkdir -p $HOME/.config/libvirt
 $ cat > $HOME/.config/libvirt <<EOF
 [credentials-nova]
 authname=nova
 password=XYZ

 [auth-libvirt-localhost]
 credentials=nova
 EOF

Finally just restart libvirtd and nova compute services

Change-Id: I011b406e54728a01eb90a7851ae2b1f536674197
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Handle verification errors in create/update in cfn API

If a StackCreate or StackUpdate call fails verification in the engine, we
get an error message returned rather than a stack identifier.

Fixes #224

Change-Id: I5f47f5d0e25e8bc05633d29605adcc8827edd379
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
get_connection should raise httplib.InvalidURL

In http.py the exception raised in get_connection
should be httplib.InvalidURL rather than httplib.InvalidUrl.

Fix for bug 1048698.

Change-Id: I7f18321fe7d8669b3b95bf823273ee8ae6961661

commit_message:
openvswitch plugin does not remove inbound unicast flow in br-tun

Fixes bug 1044565 In addition to adding port_unbound call when using rpc

Change-Id: Ie924f94bcedebbe24f3aa0a52d1682bc944a0aec

[{'created': '2012-09-10 15:54:46.000000000', 'message': 'heat tools : nova_create_flavors.sh additional retry logic

Add retry logic in order to make creating flavors more
robust.  Nova rate-limiting frequently causes actions to fail
so wrap all requests in retry/sleep logic and check we can
connect to nova before attempting to change anything

Ref #225

Change-Id: I1b1014df04602935f561c08ba29287061224b5f3
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
heat tools : nova_create_flavors.sh additional retry logic

Add retry logic in order to make creating flavors more
robust.  Nova rate-limiting frequently causes actions to fail
so wrap all requests in retry/sleep logic and check we can
connect to nova before attempting to change anything

Ref #225

Change-Id: I1b1014df04602935f561c08ba29287061224b5f3
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-10 15:54:15.000000000', 'message': "heat tools : add ephemeral disk for all flavors

Add ephemeral disk for all flavors in nova_create_flavors.sh
as it's currently not possible for EBS to work without a fixed
mapping to a specific block device name, meaning the EBS templates
will break for micro/tiny if there if no ephemeral disk defined

Change-Id: I801f00aba5b431d30362cd4b34da2f66457220c5
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
heat tools : add ephemeral disk for all flavors

Add ephemeral disk for all flavors in nova_create_flavors.sh
as it's currently not possible for EBS to work without a fixed
mapping to a specific block device name, meaning the EBS templates
will break for micro/tiny if there if no ephemeral disk defined

Change-Id: I801f00aba5b431d30362cd4b34da2f66457220c5
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2012-09-10 15:12:38.000000000', 'message': 'heat tools : check services running after openstack install

Check all expected services are running after starting them when
doing tools/openstack install, should avoid possible racy behavior
when we assume everything is up and immediately call nova_create_flavors.sh

Ref #225

Change-Id: I87ec0ca31579173cb9218fa79e027fd5b15031f0
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
heat tools : check services running after openstack install

Check all expected services are running after starting them when
doing tools/openstack install, should avoid possible racy behavior
when we assume everything is up and immediately call nova_create_flavors.sh

Ref #225

Change-Id: I87ec0ca31579173cb9218fa79e027fd5b15031f0
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Return BadRequest on create with no size for XML.

changeid I3a5d46af18f764e86ab457071d2b3afafdcdaa24 introduced
an issue with the error path for the create request. On XML create
requests BadRequest was no longer returned if the size was omitted.

A continuation of bug 1040891.

Change-Id: Ie29d683360219d51875fe2672cd690777484c32b
Signed-off-by: Matthew Treinish <treinish@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Return BadRequest on create with no size for XML.

changeid Idf8cc641162617ade2aeb77b666270cf1ce54c54 introduced
an issue with the error path for the create request. On XML create
requests BadRequest was no longer returned if the size was omitted.

A continuation of bug 1040891.

Change-Id: I1f3c7ed1e9262e9bc87f45c590d61911ea9ad06f
Signed-off-by: Matthew Treinish <treinish@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Adds the network association api docs

fixes bug 1038341

As per the bug report, there was an extension to the network API
for associating networks. This updates the API docs to reflect
this change.

See also blueprint os-api-network-associate

Change-Id: I1d23e662cf691c88a3514c09ce7a6692183cf1c3

we create for the volume being created.

commit_message:
Specify the conf file when creating a volume.

Updates the tgt-admin command to actually use the config file
we create for the volume being created.

This fixes an issue introduced in
66f6a9edce3ccd624aba5d2a6bf3362901ed57f7 which breaks iscsi
volume creation.

Fixes LP Bug #1046985.

Change-Id: I58bd23ef6dd0055a329ace8e4b09d86886aa38e9

- http://logs.openstack.org/12413/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/348 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-09-07 19:02:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I have to say that I'm wholly unconvinced that this is adding any value to Horizon for a couple reasons:

  1. The jsonutils code is designed to solve problems Horizon doesn't have.

  2. The timeutils code duplicates functionality already built into Django.

  3. This is now adding external dependencies (iso8601 python module) which *again* is duplicating built-in function in Django.

I was okay with letting jsonutils go in when it was a single piece of code and it helped promote standardization. But now things are ballooning and I'm sorely tempted to remove it from Horizon until such time as it's needed.

I'm not -2'ing this 'cuz I think it is worth further discussion (probably on the mailing list)."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-10 07:05:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Horizon is going to drop jsonutils altogether'}]

commit_message:
Sync jsonutils changes from openstack-common

Syncs the following from stable/folsom:

 9e1bd9d Add missing convert_instances arg.
 2d6f847 Track to_primitive() depth after iteritems().
 ce30714 Use strtime() in to_primitive() for datetime objs.

Also include timeutils since jsonutils now requires it. Add
iso8601 to pip-requires because timeutils requires it.

Change-Id: I8c02097471e43d6d5761176630d5e97e902a1d53

As in the bug report,
2) New filter scheduler cost function:
nova.scheduler.least_cost.retry_host_cost_fn -

commit_message:
Add retry host cost weight function to sched docs

fixes bug 1025068

As in the bug report,
2) New filter scheduler cost function:
nova.scheduler.least_cost.retry_host_cost_fn -

Adds additional cost for retrying scheduling at a host that was
already used for a previous scheduling attempt.

retry_host_cost_fn_weight is the associated FLAG to configure
weight.

this patch just adds that in.

Change-Id: I2db67144f857c3efb883b9cac45e0d5a24ae4ca9

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-08 16:44:18.000000000', 'message': "Recent changes to SolidFire API changed iqn format

 The SF API initially didn't supply the in prefix so we
 formed it manually in the OpenStack driver.

 This has been fixed in the API so we dropped the manual
 build of the prefix in volume create.  Unfortunatly missed
 the same case needed in create-from-snapshot.

 Going forward we're adding running integration tests against
 SF to catch this sort of thing.

Change-Id: I7107537d586f0a7c457dcbabfc90e1bc081d28d2
"}]
commit_message:
Recent changes to SolidFire API changed iqn format

 The SF API initially didn't supply the in prefix so we
 formed it manually in the OpenStack driver.

 This has been fixed in the API so we dropped the manual
 build of the prefix in volume create.  Unfortunatly missed
 the same case needed in create-from-snapshot.

 Going forward we're adding running integration tests against
 SF to catch this sort of thing.

Change-Id: I7107537d586f0a7c457dcbabfc90e1bc081d28d2

commit_message:
Rework functional test case infrasatructure

To support multi-instance, two new classes were made:
Stack - represents a stack
Instance - represents an instance

For multi-instance stacks, create multiple Instance objects
for each instance in the stack.

For each instance in a stack, an instance object can be created which
helps validate the individual instance sets up properly.

test_WordPress_Single_Instance_With_EBS.py fails - see issue #226

Change-Id: Iddec87cd1332a9b5796c5c7e7d382ef723c3544e
Signed-off-by: Steven Dake <sdake@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tsedovic@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>

Did you find that without this policy any user could retrieve/update/delete other people's routers?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-09-10 00:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

I have not understand why this patch is required.
Please see https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1042037/comments/5 for more detail.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-09-10 00:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I replied your questions in bug report https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1042037'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-09-10 00:21:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Yong

base.py didn't enforce it because l3 is extension now."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-10 00:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-09-10 00:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I have not understood your patch yet.

Database accesses such as _get_router() and _get_subnet() are done under the context. Thus only admin or a user who owns both a router and a subnet can add or remove a router interface even without a policy check. A regular user who does not own either a router or a subnet cannot see the router/subnet, so he cannot add/remove a router interface.

Considering the above, if we want to allow only admin to add/remove a router interface, what we need is just a policy check for the router to be modified. I do not think a policy check for a subnet/port is required.

What do you think?'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-09-10 00:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Yong 
I got it. Thanks!

> Salvatore, Akihiro
New patch is OK for you guys?'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-09-10 00:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-10 00:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

all the rule which is the same as the default ones are not need to define again in policy.json.

the base.py will enforce the default rules on the router resource's standard operations."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-09-10 00:21:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think the l3 extension is integrated into base.py, so all the router's delete, create, update and list actions are enforced by base.py. but the interface's add and remove actions are new."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-09-10 00:21:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

the interface actions are extra ones that are not called from base.py, although CRUD of router are enforced in base.py.
I want to say that these two actions actually need this fix if we need the policy enforcement on them.

please update the commit message accordingly."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-09-10 00:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

on the other hand, the get_subnet() and get_router() seems have done the same things (admin or tenant binding query),
Nachi, have u found the violation of the security without this fix?'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-09-10 00:21:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Added policy checks for add interface and remove interface

Fixes bug 1042037
admin_only policy didn't works, so policy checks
for add interface and remove interface needed.
Also updated policy.json

Change-Id: Ifec281250ccbe1680a3e634f4efdb7ba7ef3ec94

commit_message:
Add contitional update package repositories to install_package()

This helps us ensure that we update the repositories only the first time
we need to install packages

Rebased and incorporated into install_package()

Change-Id: Id987aa7742f5d6807bc97eb6784cf18557c919d2

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-05 19:18:50.000000000', 'message': 'improved Quantum plugin configuration

The configuration defaults for the openvswitch plugin are changing in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12362/ to address
https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1045142. To summarize, with no
overriding of default configuration values, tenant networks will now
work on all systems, but are now local to the host. Using GRE tunnels
or VLANs for external connectivity requires additional
configuration. This patch provides and documents a set of simple shell
variables that can be set in localrc to achieve a range of quantum
network configurations.

Note that this patch is WIP, since the comments are updated for
linuxbridge, but only openvswitch is fully implemented.

Change-Id: I72e9aba1335c55077f4a34495e2d2d9ec1857cd5
'}, {'created': '2012-09-06 21:26:32.000000000', 'message': 'improved Quantum plugin configuration

The configuration defaults for the openvswitch and linuxbridge plugins
are changing in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12362/ to address
https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1045142. To summarize, with no
overriding of default configuration values, tenant networks will now
work on all systems, but are now local to the host. Using GRE tunnels
(openvswitch) or VLANs (openvswitch or linuxbridge) for external
connectivity requires additional configuration. This patch provides
and documents a set of simple shell variables that can be set in
localrc to achieve a range of quantum network configurations.

To use GRE tunnels for remote connectivity with openvswitch, localrc
should include:

Q_PLUGIN=openvswitch
ENABLE_TENANT_TUNNELS=True

Note that OVS GRE tunnels require kernel support that is not in the
Linux kernel source tree, and is not included in all versions of Linux
on which devstack runs.

To use VLANs 1000 through 1999 on eth1 for remote connectivity with
linuxbridge, localrc should include:

Q_PLUGIN=openvswitch
ENABLE_TENANT_VLANS=True
TENANT_VLAN_RANGE=1000:1999
PHYSICAL_NETWORK=default
OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE=br-eth1

The OVS bridge br-eth1 must be manually created, and the physical
interface eth1 must be manually added as a port. Any needed host IP
address must be set on br-eth1 rather than eth1. Note that OVS bridges
and ports are persistent.

To use VLANs 1000 through 1999 on eth1 for remote connectivity with
linuxbridge, localrc should include:

Q_PLUGIN=linuxbridge
ENABLE_TENANT_VLANS=True
TENANT_VLAN_RANGE=1000:1999
PHYSICAL_NETWORK=default
LB_PHYSICAL_INTERFACE=eth1

The physical interface eth1 must be up, but does not have to have an
IP address. Any existing host IP address configured on eth1 will be
moved to a bridge when the network is activated by the agent, and
moved back when the network is deleted.

Change-Id: I72e9aba1335c55077f4a34495e2d2d9ec1857cd5
'}, {'created': '2012-09-09 13:38:29.000000000', 'message': 'improved Quantum plugin configuration

connectivity requires additional configuration. This patch provides
and documents a set of simple shell variables that can be set in
localrc to achieve a range of quantum network configurations.

To use GRE tunnels for remote connectivity with openvswitch, localrc
should include:

Q_PLUGIN=openvswitch

Note that OVS GRE tunnels require kernel support that is not in the
Linux kernel source tree, and is not included in all versions of Linux
on which devstack runs.

To use VLANs 1000 through 1999 on eth1 for remote connectivity with
linuxbridge, localrc should include:

Q_PLUGIN=openvswitch
ENABLE_TENANT_VLANS=True
TENANT_VLAN_RANGE=1000:1999
PHYSICAL_NETWORK=default
OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE=br-eth1

The OVS bridge br-eth1 must be manually created, and the physical
interface eth1 must be manually added as a port. Any needed host IP
address must be set on br-eth1 rather than eth1. Note that OVS bridges
and ports are persistent.

To use VLANs 1000 through 1999 on eth1 for remote connectivity with
linuxbridge, localrc should include:

Q_PLUGIN=linuxbridge
ENABLE_TENANT_VLANS=True
TENANT_VLAN_RANGE=1000:1999
PHYSICAL_NETWORK=default
LB_PHYSICAL_INTERFACE=eth1

The physical interface eth1 must be up, but does not have to have an
IP address. Any existing host IP address configured on eth1 will be
moved to a bridge when the network is activated by the agent, and
moved back when the network is deleted.

Change-Id: I72e9aba1335c55077f4a34495e2d2d9ec1857cd5
'}]
commit_message:
improved Quantum plugin configuration

The configuration defaults for the openvswitch and linuxbridge plugins
are changing in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12362/ to address
https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1045142. To summarize, with no
overriding of default configuration values, tenant networks will now
work on all systems, but are now local to the host. Using GRE tunnels
(openvswitch) or VLANs (openvswitch or linuxbridge) for external
connectivity requires additional configuration. This patch provides
and documents a set of simple shell variables that can be set in
localrc to achieve a range of quantum network configurations.

To use GRE tunnels for remote connectivity with openvswitch, localrc
should include:

Q_PLUGIN=openvswitch
ENABLE_TENANT_TUNNELS=True

Note that OVS GRE tunnels require kernel support that is not in the
Linux kernel source tree, and is not included in all versions of Linux
on which devstack runs.

To use VLANs 1000 through 1999 on eth1 for remote connectivity with
linuxbridge, localrc should include:

Q_PLUGIN=openvswitch
ENABLE_TENANT_VLANS=True
TENANT_VLAN_RANGE=1000:1999
PHYSICAL_NETWORK=default
OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE=br-eth1

The OVS bridge br-eth1 must be manually created, and the physical
interface eth1 must be manually added as a port. Any needed host IP
address must be set on br-eth1 rather than eth1. Note that OVS bridges
and ports are persistent.

To use VLANs 1000 through 1999 on eth1 for remote connectivity with
linuxbridge, localrc should include:

Q_PLUGIN=linuxbridge
ENABLE_TENANT_VLANS=True
TENANT_VLAN_RANGE=1000:1999
PHYSICAL_NETWORK=default
LB_PHYSICAL_INTERFACE=eth1

The physical interface eth1 must be up, but does not have to have an
IP address. Any existing host IP address configured on eth1 will be
moved to a bridge when the network is activated by the agent, and
moved back when the network is deleted.

Change-Id: I72e9aba1335c55077f4a34495e2d2d9ec1857cd5

commit_message:
Prevent from bug #1008866 is reverted

Fixes bug #1047841.

Commit 2f5360753308eb8b10581fc3c026c1b66f42ebdc (Adds new volume API
extensions) reverted a part of commit
99456bd690445443ae05c0d4fe1ec43ba6090f6f (Send 'create volume from
snapshot' to the proper host), so bug #1008866 is reproduced. I make
API.create_volume to call _cast_create_volume in cinder/volume/api.py,
it Prevent from bug #1008866 is reverted.

Change-Id: I1bf0b7c5fc47da756bce95128f8fd770d14399b0

I agree with Salvatore's comment. It is a right direction.
On the second thought, I also agree that it is reasonable approach to use network_id for this purpose in Folsom timeframe.

Regarding multiple agent support (DHCP agent, L3 agent..), we also need to consider a more general way in the next step.

Thanks"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-09-09 17:16:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

In the current implementation external network_id is used to identify a network which l3_agent work for. I prefer name-based approach to id-based approach since network_id changes whenever a network is created and a config file needs to be update whenever a external network is created.

Though network name is not unique in Quantum v2 API, I think it is not so difficult to ensure network name uniqueness within external networks (since admin user manages them). In another patch 'router:external' attribute is introduced, so we can retrieve only external networks selectively."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-09-09 17:16:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
allow multiple l3-agents to run, each with one external gateway net

bug #1042028

Allows user to invoke L3-agent in a way that limits the agent to
implementing only routers associated with a particular external network.
Thus, it is possible to have a deployment with multiple external networks,
since you can run one agent per external network.

Also makes l3-agent pay attention to router admin_state_up field.

Change-Id: Ia79d29301530718bc381c8e5a9d197de9452bce2

commit_message:
Prevent floating-ip and ex-gateway ports should prevent net deletion

bug 1044331

Old behavior meant that any port with device owner starting with
"network:" would be auto-deleted when a network was deleted.  We don't
want that behavior for floating IPs or external network gateways.
This provides a model where we explicitly list the set of owners that
should be auto-deleted.

- Also clean up NetworkInUse message to no longer mention 'attachment',
since that is API v1 terminology.

Change-Id: Icb727ae86d490456ec1ebc55cec1bf98ae6490c9

commit_message:
Create image of volume-backed instance via native API

Fixes bug 1034730.

Avoids 'qemu-img snapshot' failure when native API create_image action
is applied to a volume-backed instance.

Applies the same logic as is used to create a placeholder image from
a volume-backed instance via the EC2 API CreateImage operation, with
the now-common code refactored into the ComputeAPI class.

Change-Id: I624584ae9adbf30629f0e814d340da6b9e6e59bd

Dan,

I'd prefer to address the tunnel enablement issue under https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1045610 (revisit openvswitch agent's handling of GRE tunnels when not supported by the kernel), and therefore did not address it as part of this patch. 

My view is that we need some way to prevent disconcerting error messages when running on OSes that do not have OVS tunnel support in the kernel. Furthermore, we should make sure the agent fails loudly if tunneling is expected but not supported. A separate flag enabling/disabling tunnel support would do the job just as well as overloading the tunnel_bridge setting. Lets move that discussion to that bug report, and keep this patch focused on the connectivity defaults.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-09 12:07:13.000000000', 'message': "add local network type and use by default for tenant networks

Fixes bug 1045142.

This patch adds 'local' as a new value for provider:network_type,
supported by the openvswitch and linuxbridge plugins. Networks of this
type provide connectivity through a bridge for VMs and agents local to
the host, but no external connectivity. They do not require
provider:physical_network or provider:segmentation_id values. These
local networks are intended mainly to support single-box
zero-configuration testing (including quantum gating), but may have
other uses as well.

For openvswitch, the new OVS.tenant_network_type configuration
variable selects what type of networks are allocated as tenant
(i.e. non-provider) networks. It defaults to 'local', but must be
changed to 'vlan' or 'gre' for openvswitch tenant networks to have
external connectivity. The default value is intended to support
single-box zero-configuration testing without any need to allocate
physical network resources or configure bridges, and without requiring
the operating system to support OVS GRE tunneling. It can also be set
to 'none' to completely disable creation of tenant networks.

For linuxbridge, the new VLANS.tenant_network_type configuration
variable works similarly, with a value of 'vlan' supporting tenant
networks with external connectivity.

A corresponding devstack patch is available at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12456/. With this patch, the
openvswitch and linuxbridge plugins are by default configured to
support only local networks. A set of shell variables, documented in
stack.sh, can be set in localrc to configure remote connectivity,
including bridges/interfaces available for provider networks.

Change-Id: I2812548326141d2212d04f34d5448fb974d298e0
"}, {'created': '2012-09-09 12:07:13.000000000', 'message': "add local network type and use by default for tenant networks with openvswitch

operating system to support OVS GRE tunneling. It can also be set to
'none' to completely disable creation of tenant networks.

Change-Id: I2812548326141d2212d04f34d5448fb974d298e0
"}, {'created': '2012-09-09 12:07:13.000000000', 'message': "add local network type and use by default for tenant networks with openvswitch

This patch adds 'local' as a new value for provider:network_type,
supported by the openvswitch and linuxbridge plugins. Networks of this
type provide connectivity through a bridge for VMs and agents local to
the host, but no external connectivity. They do not require
provider:physical_network or provider:segmentation_id values. These
local networks are intended mainly to support single-box
zero-configuration testing (including quantum gating), but may have
other uses as well.

For openvswitch, the new OVS.tenant_network_type configuration
variable selects what type of networks are allocated as tenant
(i.e. non-provider) networks. It defaults to 'local', but must be
changed to 'vlan' or 'gre' for openvswitch tenant networks to have
external connectivity. The default value is intended to support
single-box zero-configuration testing without any need to allocate
physical network resources or configure bridges, and without requiring
the operating system to support OVS GRE tunneling. It can also be set
to 'none' to completely disable creation of tenant networks.

For linuxbridge, the new VLANS.tenant_network_type configuration
variable works similarly, with a value of 'vlan' supporting tenant
networks with external connectivity.

With either plugin, administrators can create provider local networks
by specifying "--provider:network_type local". Additionally, with
openvswitch, provider GRE networks can now be created by specifying
"--provider:network_type gre --provider:segmentation_id <tunnel-id>".

A corresponding devstack patch is available at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12456/. With this patch, the
openvswitch and linuxbridge plugins are by default configured to
support only local networks. A set of shell variables, documented in
stack.sh, can be set in localrc to configure remote connectivity,
including bridges/interfaces available for provider networks.

Change-Id: I2812548326141d2212d04f34d5448fb974d298e0
'}]
commit_message:
add local network type and use by default for tenant networks

Fixes bug 1045142.

This patch adds 'local' as a new value for provider:network_type,
supported by the openvswitch and linuxbridge plugins. Networks of this
type provide connectivity through a bridge for VMs and agents local to
the host, but no external connectivity. They do not require
provider:physical_network or provider:segmentation_id values. These
local networks are intended mainly to support single-box
zero-configuration testing (including quantum gating), but may have
other uses as well.

For openvswitch, the new OVS.tenant_network_type configuration
variable selects what type of networks are allocated as tenant
(i.e. non-provider) networks. It defaults to 'local', but must be
changed to 'vlan' or 'gre' for openvswitch tenant networks to have
external connectivity. The default value is intended to support
single-box zero-configuration testing without any need to allocate
physical network resources or configure bridges, and without requiring
the operating system to support OVS GRE tunneling. It can also be set
to 'none' to completely disable creation of tenant networks.

For linuxbridge, the new VLANS.tenant_network_type configuration
variable works similarly, with a value of 'vlan' supporting tenant
networks with external connectivity.

With either plugin, administrators can create provider local networks
by specifying "--provider:network_type local". Additionally, with
openvswitch, provider GRE networks can now be created by specifying
"--provider:network_type gre --provider:segmentation_id <tunnel-id>".

A corresponding devstack patch is available at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12456/. With this patch, the
openvswitch and linuxbridge plugins are by default configured to
support only local networks. A set of shell variables, documented in
stack.sh, can be set in localrc to configure remote connectivity,
including bridges/interfaces available for provider networks.

Change-Id: I2812548326141d2212d04f34d5448fb974d298e0

commit_message:
Don't start server if glance-control <SERVICE> start as non-root

Fixes bug #1046593

If non-privileged user unable to increase file descriptor limit,
do_start will direct exist and dont't start server.

Change-Id: I2c2f4f89a4236cf73edf7a3acb9144d4f6db825e

[{'created': '2012-09-05 12:16:30.000000000', 'message': 'Handled the error for existing snapshot for volume deletion

Added a code to handle if cinder returns BadRequest(400),
which is thrown in case a volume with existing active
snapshots is tried to be deleted. Probably cinder should
return a more meaningful error in this case.

This also relates to bug/1037241 - added ActionError
exception, that passes a reason for table/row action failure.

Fixes bug 1020326

Change-Id: I40e5f537bc1806ec97c21f3eeea1d74beca04250
'}, {'created': '2012-09-07 20:26:55.000000000', 'message': 'Adds a method for overriding specific API messages.

Also provides a specific error message for dependent snapshots
during volume deletion.

Fixes bug 1037241. Fixes bug 1020326.

Change-Id: I40e5f537bc1806ec97c21f3eeea1d74beca04250
'}]
commit_message:
Adds a method for overriding specific API messages.

Also provides a specific error message for dependent snapshots
during volume deletion.

Fixes bug 1037241. Fixes bug 1020326.

Change-Id: I40e5f537bc1806ec97c21f3eeea1d74beca04250

commit_message:
fix generation of exception for mismatched floating ip tenant-ids

bug 1048104

There was a KeyError in the case where we tried to throw an exception
to inform the user that a newly created floating ip could not be
associated with the requested port because they belonged to different
tenants.

Change-Id: I387e5f166761da78b941b62a9a396809491b8f09

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-24 18:36:27.000000000', 'message': "disable autorebasing on git review

Fixes bug #1035035

The default autorebasing behavior of git review can have unexpected
consequences, especially when attempting to add a new review that
is dependent on another in progress review. Like accidently turning
other people's code into drafts.

Disabling autorebase will protect us from these kinds of accidents.

There is an additional fix coming via updates to the git review
extension, but as someone tripped over autorebasing yesterday it
seems safe to also fix it in the repo in the config file.

Change-Id: Id1d04192322ec78e6cfb154a317cccd62fa84361
"}]
commit_message:
disable autorebasing on git review

Fixes bug #1035035

The default autorebasing behavior of git review can have unexpected
consequences, especially when attempting to add a new review that
is dependent on another in progress review. Like accidently turning
other people's code into drafts.

Disabling autorebase will protect us from these kinds of accidents.

There is an additional fix coming via updates to the git review
extension, but as someone tripped over autorebasing yesterday it
seems safe to also fix it in the repo in the config file.

Change-Id: Id1d04192322ec78e6cfb154a317cccd62fa84361

[{'created': '2012-09-07 13:13:25.000000000', 'message': "rbd: implement create_volume_from_snapshot

In an upcoming release, rbd will support creating volumes from
snapshots ('cloning'). To clone a snapshot, it must first be
'protected', which means it cannot be deleted until it is unprotected.
A snapshot can only be unprotected if no clones depend on it. Thus,
translate a failure to unprotect into a SnapshotIsBusy exception.

Also check for remaining snapshots before deleting a volume,
and raise VolumeIsBusy if any exist. While we're here, tidy up
the shell arguments to be more readable.

This is backwards compatible since it does not use the new features
unless they are available in the installed version of rbd.

(cherry picked from cinder commit ff45e32)

Change-Id: If4105e7af7ba33f09a15103b53ad675aceb2ebb4
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>
"}]
commit_message:
rbd: implement create_volume_from_snapshot

In an upcoming release, rbd will support creating volumes from
snapshots ('cloning'). To clone a snapshot, it must first be
'protected', which means it cannot be deleted until it is unprotected.
A snapshot can only be unprotected if no clones depend on it. Thus,
translate a failure to unprotect into a SnapshotIsBusy exception.

Also check for remaining snapshots before deleting a volume,
and raise VolumeIsBusy if any exist. While we're here, tidy up
the shell arguments to be more readable.

This is backwards compatible since it does not use the new features
unless they are available in the installed version of rbd.

(cherry picked from cinder commit ff45e32)

Change-Id: If4105e7af7ba33f09a15103b53ad675aceb2ebb4
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

commit_message:
Add IP version check for IP address fields.

Fixes bug 1046952

In create/update_subnet(), IP address fields (cidr, gateway_ip, host_routes,
dns_nameserver) should be checked whether they are consistent with IP version
specified. IP version check for allocation_pools is already implemented,
so this commit adds IP version checks for other IP fields.

Change-Id: Ic02f5a1fd8ec4c1c363599c906ba0c818dd22268

commit_message:
Set install_requires in setup.py.

Updates setup.py to set install_requires using parse_requirements from
openstack-common.  This allows DevStack to install nova requirements, as
currently they are not handled.

Also relaxes the version requirement for lxml to >=2.3,<3.  This allows
DevStack to install nova requirements without needing to install lxml
over the installed python-xml system package, currently 2.3.2.

Change-Id: Iccebf9604ba5c6fcacb4c5fa5004f9fcb08944f3

I am continuing to break stack.sh down into service-specific libraries similar to how lib/cinder is today.  I'm not asking you to do this now, just to start the process by not adding service-specific functions to the functions file."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-29 18:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-29 19:13:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me
